revision.comment: Created page with "just thought id post an update that pertains to this-thread in particular... this past wednesday was the end of the current-cycle of the [[Adrift]] event... the thing that k..."
revision.text:
just thought id post an update that pertains to this-thread in particular...
this past wednesday was the end of the current-cycle of the [[Adrift]] event... the thing that kinda astounded me was - that the thermometer/common-prizes were not completed in time... in particular (since i was online and waiting till the last-minute, just-in-case) only the easy-prizes were available to be mind-melded... the medium and hard prizes were short by less than 10% of the points needed...
anyways, i was quite bummed-out because those mind-meld prizes are some of the most-beneficial to receive in many cases...
in general, i have completed all the 5 different [[:category:events]] at least once - and am going thru the fine-tuning of details... once that is complete - i plan to go back to getting ship-details (code-refactoring) put in correctly, and then also trying to determine what (if anything) anyone else might find useful for/from this wikia...
feel free to come and edit, ask questions, or whatever... im around most every day for a bit, just checking on things... have fun, h.

Wellp, apparently THIS week we will get a couple more characters - so i got to looking at how-to-add them again... turns out last time i missed a few spots, and so lets catch up with them first... # [[Hero table]] is where (a long time ago) i would try to post the names-i-was-considering and see if anyone was here/reading and wanted to vote/cared... # [[Template:TiermaxALL]] is where (more recently) ive been trying to hold the same information (or a bit more)... particularly because i can look thru (and sort) the ships and characters to check for repeating KEYS... altho, the non-auto-numbering-table is pretty annoying at this point... otoh, having to go thru the table forces me to think-about (fully) exactly how many characters there are (at this point 85)... # [[Template:CrewALL]] is auto-populated, which is the BEST place to try out adding the new-keys to the database and seeing if/how they show up... # [[Special:Disambiguations]] is auto-populated, but the SPECIFIC pages for the new characters, like [[Scott]], [[Troi]], [[Chekov]], and [[Beverly]] are what actually need the new/useful additions..
also, when [[CN/DBC]] showed up as a purchasable character (after the event) in the [[Archive Area]] - i was able to add most of her data into the actual [[Module:Charactercodes/data|crew database]]... she is still missing HP and ag/ar/aw values - but mostly she is there...
eta: another important thing to update: [[Template:Characters_Navbox]]
eta2: the two new characters have keys: CDT and EMS, for troi and scott, at [[CN/CDT]] and [[CO/EMS]] - which will get filled in sometime fairly soon (i hope)...

revision.text:
Wow. This is great! I'll have to read through and process this.
We just moved a few states away, so I've been running around getting everything for work and moving settled, but this week should be more stable, if not so much in the game itself.
#redirect [[Captain Troi]]
#redirect [[Eng.Capt. Scott]]

ok - so yesterday, i just added the two new keys into the database... the full-extent of their input-data was as follows: 
 	
	CDT = { -- lvl-tbd
        name = '[[Captain Troi]]',
		aliases = 'Troi, Captain Deanna Troi',
		image = 'Captain Deanna Troi.png',
		imagecaption = 'Captain Deanna Troi',
		igp = 'troi',
		tier = 3,
		series = 'TNG',
	},
	EMS = { -- lvl-tbd
        name = '[[Eng.Capt. Scott]]',
		aliases = 'Scotty, Engineering Captain Scott',
		image = 'Eng. Captain Scott.png',
		imagecaption = 'Engineeing Captain Montgomery Scott',
		igp = 'scott',
		tier = 3,
		series = 'TOS',
	},
once id done-that, they showed-up as red-links in the {{t|crewALL}} template... so today, i went ahead and setup their simple-default pages... from the crewall-template, i first clicked on [[Cmdr. Troi]] so that i could have the mostly-correct data for her captain-version... clicked on source-edit, and i just selected-all and copied-to-clipboard all the inner-source-module+template-calls... next, i clicked on the captain.troi red-link from the crewall-template... then i just pasted the clipboard - changed the keys from CDR to CDT and the 2 (tier) to 3 - and saved the page... this then autopopulated the [[Captain Troi]] link... then, i clicked on the CN/CDT red-link from the crewall-template and typed the exact info: #redirect [[Captain Troi]] and now the new-troi setup was effectively-started... do the same-sequence (make main-page, then redirect-link) for the tier-3 scotty and that is all that i will document for this post... hth, h. eta - since i havent scraped their photos, the image-links in the crewall-template are still red-links...

revision.comment: Created page with "This post will help to answer "what the f**k?" about the [[Events Sequence]] area... * If there is an [[:Category:Events|Event]] active at the moment, hopefully it is listed ..."
revision.text:
This post will help to answer "what the f**k?" about the [[Events Sequence]] area...
* If there is an [[:Category:Events|Event]] active at the moment, hopefully it is listed on the [[:Star Trek Wrath of Gems Wikia/Calendar|Calendar]] for today's date... *# The events (currently only 5 different events) repeat in the sequence listed in the Table of Contents for [[:Category:Events]]... *# For simplicity (in order), they are listed here as: [[Empty of the Mind]], [[Adrift]], [[Isolated Station]], [[Event-Equilibrium|Equilibrium]], and [[Missing]]... * Each Event has its own page which will detail all of the Enemies, the Plot, and the Prizes that are available to win... * Overall, there are three (3) [[:Category:TOS]] and two (2) [[:Category:TNG]] Events...
Feel free to ask-questions or add-comments to this thread - so that it can become useful (like a STICKY)...<ac_metadata title="Events - WTF ?" related_topics="Events Sequence"> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "Right now I am a bit annoyed that I didn't save up my gold earlier because we received 4 new characters, via Arenas, within a few weeks of each-other... I was only able to pu..."
revision.text:
Right now I am a bit annoyed that I didn't save up my gold earlier because we received 4 new characters, via Arenas, within a few weeks of each-other... I was only able to purchase (or win) 2 of them - and I have a fondness for The-Original-Series, so I'm currently missing the latest [[Crusher]] and [[Captain Troi]] from TNG... As it turns out, if I had purchased the less-costly ones first - I would have been able to complete my set... Oh well...
Also, how far have yall evolved/levelled-up your characters ?
I decided, awhile ago, that I would only level-up every character to 50 - until I had all of them... However, I did level-up a few of my starships to 95/96 recently... I have become jealous of some of the 165-characters or starships that I've seen on other people's rosters...
Interestingly, I do not USE all the different characters or starships because it gets to be too-complicated for me to try to optimize my battle-strategy... It is easier to just pick my favorites, play them as well as I can, and go on to the next-battle...
have fun, h.<ac_metadata title="Do you have all the characters and/or starships ?"> </ac_metadata>

local function getTablefromKey(k,tblNm) -- having brain-farts whether to return true/false or msgs... local fake = {} local retmsg='getTable-fail' local retval,retTBL -- set SorC before this call... fake[1]=glbls.sorc fake[2]=tostring(k) if not tblNm then --retval='Get FullKey...' retval = comns.getFullKey(fake) retTBL = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(retval) if type(retTBL) ~= 'table' then retTBL = {} retTBL["key"]=k end glbls.data = utils.tableShallowCopy(retTBL) glbls.holdTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(retTBL) return retval -- early end fake[3]=tostring(tblNm) retval=comns.passTBL(fake) if not retval or retval ~= 'false' then retTBL = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(retval) retmsg = true else return retmsg end glbls.data = utils.tableShallowCopy(retTBL) return retval end
local function addHeaderSkills() local row = mw.html.create('tr') local cols = {'upgrade','cost','description',} for _,c in ipairs(cols) do row:tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(c)):done() end return row end
local function addHeader(cols) local row = mw.html.create('tr') local usecols = {} if not cols or type(cols)~='table' then usecols = glbls.choices else --usecols = chooseCols(cols) usecols = cols end -- the :tag adds nodes-to-builder (row) and returns updated-instance (row) for _,c in ipairs(usecols) do if c=='key' then row :tag('th') :css('width','8%') :wikitext('Key'):done() elseif c=='series' then row :tag('th'):wikitext('TOS/TNG'):done() elseif c=='hp' or c=='tier' then local nam = c:upper() row :tag('th') :css('width','8%') --:cssText(' scope="col" data-sort-type="numeric" ') :attr('scope','col') :attr('data-sort-type','numeric') :wikitext(nam):done() else row --:tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(tostring(c))):done() :tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(c)):done() --:tag('th'):wikitext(c):done() end -- endfor end return row end
local function isValidEvol(val) local retval=false local nEv=utils.toNum(val,9999) if utils.isBlank(val) then retval = true else local possEV = {9999,3,9,10,15} for _,v in pairs(possEV) do if nEv == v then retval = true end end end return retval end
local function matchKeys2Values(inStr) local chkStr,chkTbl local mkTbl,rettbl local retstr='' local cntr chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(glbls.chkTbl) --if type(chkTbl) ~= 'table' then return 'bad inTbl?' end chkStr = string.upper(tostring(inStr)) mkTbl = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(chkStr) rettbl = {} cntr = utils.tblFullSize(chkTbl) if #mkTbl ~= cntr then return false end -- early -- now, just hand-merge the tables... for k,idx in pairs(chkTbl) do rettbl[k] = mkTbl[idx] end glbls.chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(rettbl) retstr = utils.dumpTable(rettbl) --[[ retstr = retstr..tostring(cntr)..utils.dumpTable(rettbl) retstr = 'YAY' --]] return retstr end
local function chooseSubTbl(inStr) local chkStr,chkTbl local mkTbl,rettbl local retstr='' local cntr=0 chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(glbls.chkTbl) if type(chkTbl) ~= 'table' then return 'bad inTbl?' end --if glbls.sorc == 'c' then inTbl = currentCrewKeys end --if glbls.sorc == 's' then inTbl = currentShipKeys end chkStr = string.upper(tostring(inStr)) mkTbl = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(chkStr) rettbl = {} if type(mkTbl) == 'table' then for _,gdKey in ipairs(chkTbl) do if type(gdKey) == 'string' then for k,v in pairs(mkTbl) do if tostring(k)==gdKey then --retstr = 'KV: found a Key in gdKey... ' --retstr = retstr..'KK;' retstr = true -- mkTbl is in key/level pairs, so copy... rettbl[k]=v end if tostring(v)==gdKey then --retstr = 'KO: found a Value in gdKey... ' retstr = retstr..'KV;' cntr=cntr+1 -- mkTbl is most-likely just an array of keys... if type(k)=='number' then rettbl[gdKey]=k else --retstr = retstr..'BUT dont understand structure...' retstr = retstr..'err|' end end end -- loop input-table end -- if-string end -- loop good-key-list else retstr = false end --if #rettbl > 0 then if utils.tblFullSize(rettbl) > 0 then --glbls.data = utils.tableShallowCopy(rettbl) glbls.chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(rettbl) --glbls.chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(junk) --retstr = 'YAY' end --[[ retstr = retstr..tostring(cntr)..utils.dumpTable(rettbl) -- retstr = 'YAY' --]] return retstr end
local function chooseOldNew(inStr) local chkStr,chkTbl local useTOS,useTNG local retstr,rettbl chkStr = string.upper(tostring(inStr)) chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(glbls.chkTbl) if string.find(chkStr,'O') then useTOS = true else useTOS = false end if string.find(chkStr,'N') then useTNG = true else useTNG = false end if useTOS and useTNG then retstr = ' ON ' rettbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(chkTbl) elseif useTOS then retstr = ' O ' rettbl = {'needs work to choose O...',} elseif useTNG then retstr = ' N ' rettbl = {'needs work to choose N...',} else retstr = false rettbl = {'nothing-chosen...',} end glbls.chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(rettbl) return retstr end
local function chkCrew(c) -- assume dummy-values, but put in valid ones if available... assert(type(c)=='table') local dummy = 'dummy' local rettbl = {} for _,k in ipairs(possibles) do local ans = tostring(c[k]) if utils.isNotBlank(ans) then rettbl[k] = ans else rettbl[k] = dummy end end return rettbl end

--outDiv -- :attr('id',key) -- :wikitext('Key '..chooseHero..' is called ') -- :wikitext("'''[["..heroName.."]]'''.") -- :newline() -- :newline()
if key == chooseHero then row :css('text-align','center;') :tag('td'):wikitext(key):done() :tag('td'):wikitext(name):done() :tag('td'):wikitext(levelReached):done() else row :css('text-align','right;') :tag('td'):wikitext('FAIL'):done() end
return row --return outDiv end
local function addRowSkills( idx, tbl ) local row = mw.html.create('tr') local cost = tbl[idx]['cost'] row :css('text-align','center;') :tag('td'):wikitext(idx):done() :tag('td'):wikitext(cost):done()
local desc = tbl[idx]['desc'] row :css('text-align','left;') :tag('td'):wikitext(desc):done() return row end

if rtbl.key ~= k then return false end -- early... --if rtbl.key ~= k then return mkTableTextListOne(k,'Level 3') end --[[ if not chosens then chosens = possibles end if type(chosens)~='table' then chosens = possibles end for _,c in ipairs(chosens) do fakeFrame[2] = c chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then rtbl[c] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end --]] -- cannot pass back tables ? -- return rtbl return tempStr end

local function addRow( crew, cols ) -- Init local row = mw.html.create('tr') local defaultCols = { 'key', 'image', 'aliases', }
if not cols then usecols = glbls.choices else -- this should double-check the table... -- usecols = chooseCols(cols) usecols = cols end
for _,c in ipairs(usecols) do if c=='key' then row :css('text-align','center;') :tag('td'):wikitext(crew.key) elseif c=='series' then row :tag('td'):wikitext(crew.series) elseif c=='hp' then row :tag('td'):wikitext(crew.hp) elseif c=='tier' then row :tag('td'):wikitext(crew.tier) else row :tag('td'):wikitext(crew.c) --:tag('td'):wikitext('other'):done() end end
--return row return row:done() end

local function mkList() local fakeFrame = {} local retOut local r -- to hold extra nodes/rows local row local retval,tempStr,allKeys -- too many cols invokes script-errors... --local myCols = {'key','level','limit','name','tier','series',} -- hack !!! so that level can be compared inline semi-quickly... local myCols = {'key','limit','level','name',} local myColsHdr = {'key','limit','my level','name',} --local myCols = {'key','level','limit','name',} local gdKeys = {} local mkRowWanted = {} local doTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(glbls.chkTbl) -- table has key/level pairs... retOut = utils.dumpTableSorted(doTbl)..'\n\n* '

return retOut
end
local function mkIndex(k) local fakeFrame = {} local retval,tempStr,keysEnc,allKeys -- first loadup the glbl-tbls... fakeFrame[1] = glbls.sorc fakeFrame[2] = 'full' fakeFrame[3] = 'keylist' tempStr = comns.main(fakeFrame) if not tempStr then return tempStr end -- -- hacky decode of the JSON... -- -- use rest-of-string after-equal-sign... -- keysEnc = utils.splitStrPat(tempStr,'=+') -- allKeys = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(keysEnc[#keysEnc]) allKeys = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(tempStr) glbls.keys = utils.tableShallowCopy(allKeys) retval = utils.dumpTable(allKeys) --retval = utils.dumpTable(glbls.keys) NOGOOD... local r -- to hold extra nodes/rows glbls.out = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') r = addHeader() glbls.out:node(r) -- adds a child-node of (row) to current-instance (table) for _,key in ipairs(allKeys) do r = mkRow(key) glbls.out:node(r) end r = addHeader() glbls.out:node(r) return glbls.out --if type(allKeys) ~= 'table' then return 'ERROR...' end --return retval end
local function loadCrewSkillsBegin(k) -- bring in full skills-table for key-k... local fakeFrame = {} local getvals,chkreadargs local tempStr local rtbl = {} -- string holds ENcoded, glbls.data holds table, sorc predone tempStr = getTablefromKey(k,'skills') --rtbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(glbls.data) local basics = {'skill','color','cost',} --local basics = {'skill','color','cost','desc',} for i = 1,3 do rtbl[i] = {} for _,c in ipairs(basics) do tempStr = c..tostring(i) rtbl[i][c] = glbls.data[tempStr] end -- remove empty-skills if utils.tblFullSize(rtbl[i]) == 0 then rtbl[i] = nil end end --]] return rtbl end
local function checkSorC(str) -- klugey, but... local retval = false local retstr = 'x' if type(str)=='string' then if string.len(str)==1 then retstr = string.lower(str) end if retstr=='c' or retstr=='s' then retval = true end end return retval,retstr end
local function loadCrewSkillsEnd(k,begtbl) local fakeFrame = {} local getStr,retval local rtbl = {} fakeFrame[1]=glbls.sorc fakeFrame[2]=tostring(k) for sk,_ in ipairs(begtbl) do rtbl[sk] = {} fakeFrame[3]=sk --local defCost = begtbl[sk]['cost'] for up = 1,5 do rtbl[sk][up] = {} getStr = 'desc' fakeFrame[4]=getStr fakeFrame[5]=up -- this forces all skill-upgrades to provide a 'desc' field !!! retval = comns.SkFt(fakeFrame) rtbl[sk][up][getStr] = retval getStr = 'cost' fakeFrame[4]=getStr retval = comns.SkFt(fakeFrame) rtbl[sk][up][getStr] = retval end end return rtbl -- return 'main-fail' end
local function mkColorDiv(skColor,txt) local tmp, tmp2, tmp3 -- need more checks on 'color'... assert(type(skColor)=='string') tmp2 = skColor:lower()..";" if utils.isBlank(txt) then txt = skColor end tmp3 = '[[:Category:'..txt..'|'..txt..']]' tmp = mw.html.create('span') tmp :css('color',tmp2) -- :wikitext(txt) :wikitext(tmp3) return tmp end
local function makeEvolutions(key) local LvlNms = {'50','95','96','165',} local OKitems = {'name','series','tier',} local beg,mid,tr,sl,nl local ok,retstr local tempstr,mKey mKey = tostring(key) -- string is JUNK, glbls.data holds table, sorc predone tempStr = getTablefromKey(mKey,nil) beg = '* [[' mid = string.upper(glbls.sorc) mid = mid..string.sub(glbls.data['series'],2,2) -- tNg or tOs -- sigh... beg = beg..mid tr = tonumber( string.sub(glbls.data['tier'],1,1) ) -- shorten 3.5 to 3 sl = '/' nl = ']] \n\n' --retstr = beg..sl..mid..sl..mKey..nl retstr = '' if tr == 1 then tempstr = beg..sl..'L50'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr elseif tr == 2 then tempstr = beg..sl..'L50'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr tempstr = beg..sl..'L95'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr elseif tr == 3 then tempstr = beg..sl..'L50'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr tempstr = beg..sl..'L96'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr tempstr = beg..sl..'L165'..sl..mKey..nl retstr = retstr..tempstr else retstr = false end return retstr end
local function mkTableSkillsOne(begT,endT,chooseNum) local r local outDiv = mw.html.create('div') local outTbl = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') --glbls.out = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') local skName = begT[chooseNum]['skill'] local skColor = begT[chooseNum]['color']
outDiv :attr('id',skName) :wikitext('Skill Number '..chooseNum..' is called ') :wikitext("'''"..skName.."'''.") :newline() --:wikitext('Its color is '..skColor..'.') :wikitext('Its color is ') --:node(mkColorDiv(skColor)):done() :node(mkColorDiv(skColor)) :wikitext('. '..gems.one({skColor,'15'})) :newline()
r = addHeaderSkills() outTbl:node(r)
--local upgrTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(endT[chooseNum]) local upgrTbl = endT[chooseNum] for up = 1,#upgrTbl do r = addRowSkills(up,upgrTbl) outTbl:node(r) end
outDiv :node(outTbl) :newline() :newline() :newline() :newline() --:tag('hr') --:done()
return outDiv end
local function mkTableSkills(begT,endT) local retOut glbls.out = mw.html.create() for i=1,#begT do retOut = mkTableSkillsOne(begT,endT,i):done() glbls.out:node(retOut) end return glbls.out -- return 'main-fail' end
function p._main(frame) -- this cleans up outside (or INside) calls for args local a a = utils.tableShallowCopy(getargs(frame)) if #a == 0 then return false end glbls.args = a return true end
function p.main(frame) local retval = 'invalid call to CommonLists-main: ' local a,sorc,mKey,mItem local ok,tempStr if not p._main(frame) then retval = retval..'zero arguments passed' return retval end a = glbls.args sorc = a[1] ok,tempStr = checkSorC(sorc) if ok then glbls.sorc = tempStr glbls.args[1] = tempStr -- bypass REchecking later... else return 'invalid sorc-value >>'..tostring(sorc)..'<<' end --mKey = a[2] --mItem = a[3] local what = a[2] local how = a[3] local which = a[4] local value = a[5] local dummy = a[6] local out local capNi,capNc capNi=string.match(what,'index(%d+)') capNc=string.match(what,'count(%d+)') -- subtle, the captures (if worked) will return TRUEs if what=='index' then -- eventually pass more stuff like chooseCols, etc... out = mkIndex() elseif capNi then if capNi == '0' then out = mkIndex0() else -- replace obscure side-case of 4==3.5 if capNi == '4' then out = mkIndex_N(3.5) else out = mkIndex_N(capNi) end end elseif capNc then if capNc == '0' then out = mkCount0() else -- replace obscure side-case of 4==3.5 if capNc == '4' then out = mkCount_N(3.5) else out = mkCount_N(capNc) end end elseif (what=='testSkills') or (what=='skills') then local begtbl = loadCrewSkillsBegin(how) local endtbl = loadCrewSkillsEnd(how,begtbl) if what=='skills' then out = mkTableSkills(begtbl,endtbl) else out = utils.dumpTable(begtbl) out = out..'\n\n'..utils.dumpTable(endtbl) end elseif (what=='dbgMyList') or (what=='MyList') then local dbgstr = 'CommonLists-MyList:' local junk = dbgstr..' FAIL: ' local ok = false local tOstNg local enTbl local tbdVals local fullTbl = {} if what=='dbgMyList' then ok = true end -- rather than hard-coded, could use comns.main(full,keylist) if glbls.sorc == 'c' then fullTbl = currentCrewKeys end if glbls.sorc == 's' then fullTbl = currentShipKeys end if how then local tmpVal --tOstNg = tostring(how) -- ugly, but modify table in chooseOldNew (if nec.) glbls.chkTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(fullTbl) tmpVal = chooseOldNew(how) if not tmpVal then return junk..'ON' end -- early... tOstNg = tmpVal ok = true elseif ok then tOstNg = 'xxx ON xxx;' else tOstNg = junk..'tOstNg ' end if which and ok then local tmpVal enTbl = tostring(which) tmpVal = chooseSubTbl(which) if not tmpVal then return junk..'TBL' end -- early... enTbl = tmpVal -- stupid, just for printing... if tmpVal == true then -- Full-KK key-value info already provided... ok = false enTbl = '--- enTbl ---' else ok = true end elseif ok then enTbl = 'xxx enTbl xxx;' else ok = false enTbl = junk..'enTbl ' end if value and ok then local tmpVal tbdVals = 'HI...'..tostring(value) tmpVal = matchKeys2Values(value) if not tmpVal then return junk..'val-TBL' end -- early... tbdVals = tmpVal -- more stupid printing... ok = true elseif ok then tbdVals = 'xxx tbdVals xxx'..' assuming all items are Level 0' --tbdVals = 'xxx tbdVals xxx'..utils.dumpTable(glbls.chkTbl) --tbdVals = 'xxx tbdVals xxx'..utils.JSONencodeTable2String(glbls.chkTbl) else ok = false tbdVals = junk..'tbdVals ' end if what=='MyList' then --out = dbgstr..tOstNg..enTbl..tbdVals..'\n\n* ' --out = out..utils.dumpTable(glbls.chkTbl) out = mkList() --out = utils.dumpTable(glbls.chkTbl)..'\n\n* ' else --out = dbgstr..tOstNg..enTbl..tbdVals out = dbgstr..'prt-'..glbls.sorc out = out..'\n\n*'..utils.JSONencodeTable2String(fullTbl) end --[[ --]] elseif (what=='dbgEVLnks') or (what=='EVLnks') then local dbgstr = 'CommonLists-EVLnks:' local junk = dbgstr..' FAIL: ' local retstr = makeEvolutions(how) -- either pass a string - or nil/false if not retstr then return junk end -- early... if what=='EVLnks' then out = tostring(retstr) else out = dbgstr..'nothing to debug...' end out = tostring(retstr) else -- out = "Hello, world! - doing..."..what..utils.dumpTable(glbls.data) out = "Hello, world! - for... "..tostring(sorc).. " doing... "..tostring(what).. " ...using how... "..tostring(how).. " ...choosing which... "..tostring(which).. " ...as value... "..tostring(value).." ???\n\n\n" end return tostring( out ) end
return p

revision.comment: Created page with "i think alliances got borked in the last day or so... on my phone, i noticed that when i go to the alliances-tab - it asks me if i want to JOIN, rather than showing me the al..."
revision.text:
i think alliances got borked in the last day or so... on my phone, i noticed that when i go to the alliances-tab - it asks me if i want to JOIN, rather than showing me the alliance that i am already-a-member-of... also, in the current arenas - i am not showing my alliances positions (just empty-dashes) correctly...
however, when i lookup my alliance - i still my userid as a player within it... but, i cannot select the player-stats (of myself or anyone else) - i just get a blank-ish screen...
normally, i would just chalk this up to another memory-leak issue in the program and log-out and start-over... however, this does not seem to fix the problem for me...<ac_metadata title="alliances borked today ?"> </ac_metadata>
{{Level95}}
{{Level95}}
* None of the utility functions below work as callable except WITHIN other modules, because these functions are not expecting FRAMES...

revision.comment: Created page with "sigh - so i guess the alliances are basically fixed now... however, i am going to make some educated guesses to help describe the situation as i understand-it and guess about..."
revision.text:
sigh - so i guess the alliances are basically fixed now... however, i am going to make some educated guesses to help describe the situation as i understand-it and guess about what to do for others...
1 - the app itself was not borked, but there is a server running in the background that got borked... of course this is semi-obvious because there is no way that alliances could exist (in its current form) without a server to do the heavy-lifting... unfortunately, because i was worried about missing out on alliance accumulations that were happening - i made some mistakes...
a - mistake_1: i tried several of the app-available options to see how they worked... normally that would be fine, but since these options did not seem to do anything (remember the SERVER mustve been borked - a bit); i kept trying more-and-more-extravagant options... in particular, eventually, i created my OWN public-facing alliance... it is called semi-obviously-enough: hfelton...
b - mistake_2: when i looked-around to see how other folks, that i assumed were more-knowledgeable that i, were handling their situations - they had done mistake_1 also... in particular, i had (still-am? idk!) been a member of a very-high-ranking public alliance called [[Tbd...]] which had an admin that i respected... unfortunately, by following his/her-lead i was not paying attention when they fixed the problem with the SERVER... in the meantime, i now had a second member join my public alliance...
2 - now that the server is/was running correctly again, some more of the lovely bugs that plague this game became apparent to me... the following guesses (as many of my other guesses about how this game/app was originally coded) about the SERVER, i am not sure will continue to be true, but for now they help explain things to my satisfaction...
a - once reset, my new alliance is/was only accumulating points since they had done the reset... i guess this is fine, since the alliance itself had only existed this long - this caused the final-tallies of the latest [[Arena Sequence]] to be quite-dissapointing... sigh...
b - also, the latest [[Events Sequence]] will finish tomorrow and my alliance will only be ranked based upon these latest accumulations... however, afaict, all the OTHER alliances (that existed before the server-borking) are back-to-normal... this is evidenced by being able to see the players/admins screens working again... unfortunately for my old high-ranking-alliance, the admin (and i) are basically locked-out because we made mistake_2 above...
3 - this server-borking has happened in the past, and i was not paying too much attention to it... since they eventually always fixed it (and back-fixed all the tallies for events/arenas that mightve recently expired [in the past]) - i could now just delete my new alliance and hopefully drop back to my old/other high-ranking one... i am NOT going to do this, since this general game's lack-of-communication is one of its worst aspects...
SO - using this post/thread - i am hereby announcing that my alliance will remain public (and join-able) until it is full... if there is some other way that folks communicate, that i am not aware of - please let me know... in the meantime, enjoy the game (as much as the bugs will allow you to) - and i hope to see yall around sometime...
hugs, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "this is just a thread to allow discussions among alliance members - if they stumble over here... my alliance is called hfelton (as the title indicates), and currently it cont..."
revision.text:
this is just a thread to allow discussions among alliance members - if they stumble over here... my alliance is called hfelton (as the title indicates), and currently it contains myself and one-other player... in theory, i might name the players here - but i dont want to "out" anyone without their permissions...
however, for fun, i am going to make threads-titles for the other top-8 (out of the top-25, not top-15) alliances i see tonite... maybe if someone from those alliances wants to reach-out here, we can get some discussions going...
sincerely, h.<ac_metadata title="ALL: hfelton"> </ac_metadata>

revision.text:
ok - i changed my mind... yes, it happens...
the other-member in this alliance bailed out yesterday, noone new joined, it is very-close to the end-of-the-event, and i am hoping that the server will get reset again and put me back into my old-high-ranking-alliance correctly...
we shall see
h.

revision.comment: Created page with "see [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:1248 here], but im now trying to go-back to my old alliance... i have tried everything i can think of within/around the app-itself to ..."
revision.text:
see [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:1248 here], but im now trying to go-back to my old alliance...
i have tried everything i can think of within/around the app-itself to try and get the SERVER to reset my id so that it relinks to my old alliance...
at the moment, i am currently showing as not-a-member of ANY alliance - and the event will end later today...
presumably the server gets reset again at the end of each event or alliance and relinks the borked-userids where they belong... idk... in particular, i made sure to win at least one non-alliance victory in each of the three event-types - assuming that having a points-difference will help the relinking process to do its job...
we shall see, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "ok - this game is such a GRIND... as i suspected, the alliances are reset AFTER each event or arena concludes... unfortunately, that means (in my case) that i missed out o..."
revision.text:
ok - this game is such a GRIND...
as i suspected, the alliances are reset AFTER each event or arena concludes... unfortunately, that means (in my case) that i missed out on all the alliance-rewards from the EVENT that ended yesterday... sigh...
on the bright-side, however, it looks like i have become reattached to my alliance correctly tho... thus, for the ARENAS that are soon-to-be concluded - i will again start to receive alliance-rewards...
of course, this all still begs the question: what happened on the server to cause me to disassociate from my alliance to begin with ? who knows... it, like many of the other memory-leaks or bugs, just seems to happen... i guess i can be zen about it...
the fact that they are still producing a bit of new material - is nice... if i had to guess, the reason that this game is still worthwhile for the creators to keep up with is - we are still a money-source (from watching of the ads from the roullette wheel)...
also, this experience starts to remind me why i have been confused by the timing of the ARENAS over the past... it seemed like some of them (arenas) were longer or shorter than a standard amount... however, i am fairly-sure that just before the end of every EVENT - there were a sequence of ARENAS that would end...
presumably, this is their solution to borked alliance problems on the SERVER... make sure that there is an ARENA that ends (and hopefully every borked-user plays in it so that the server will "see" them) just before the end of the EVENT... thus, the user will be reset and regain their alliance-prizes for the more-lucrative EVENT...
sigh... iirc, in the past when i became borked - i didnt particularly care because some silly arena ended (which reset my alliance-connection afterwards) and then i was good-to-go again for the end of the event...
also, to be fair, the server needs some way to mark the beginning and end of alliances themselves... so, having the reset-code there makes some sense... of course, since this game is so buggy - noone has bothered to figure out where/why the a long-time user would get borked into/out-of their alliance...
hmmmmm... wait - my alliance admin... lol... he/she is still borked... oh - that explains it... sigh...

revision.text:
going good... glad to see you - nice trivia-addition to [[Terrhea]]...
what are your thoughts on the spoiler-alert idea ? i have completely avoided (read: lazy) mentioning storyline-stuff, but it is great that you thought to add it... my question is more about "should we hide storyline stuff behind spoiler-warnings like the big-one on [[:Star Trek Wrath of Gems Wikia:Spoilers]] ?"
im up for whatever makes sense to you - even just the little text-warning as-is... or not... it's all good... regardless, thanx again... how are you doing ?? hope your move (personal) and gameplay (social) are going well...
hugs, h.
ps - i never finished the code-refactor cuz got lazy, but at least all the ships (when i get home can add latest-two) are minimally documented... :-)

* vulcans (specifically, their weapons) are now showing with an info-icon which i have not yet scraped from the gamecode... for the moment, vulcans are only showing as [[TOS]] but presumably they will be [[TNG]] as well... * ferengis (also) SHOULD be showing up with an info-icon from TNG mainly, altho they did-exist during TOS-earth timelines... i dont think i have seen their info-icon yet... [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 09:48, December 27, 2017 (UTC)

revision.text:
Not doing too bad. I didn't see any harm in adding some story info. I thought it would help get people interested in the characters.
One time, I was doing an Arena thing for the Enterprise B (I think), and I ended up clawing my way to third.

revision.comment: Created page with "Cool idea (story additions to get others interested)... My thoughts (also) were that anyone who wouldve gotten far enough to stumble here would not be bothered by spoilers......"
revision.text:
Cool idea (story additions to get others interested)... My thoughts (also) were that anyone who wouldve gotten far enough to stumble here would not be bothered by spoilers... In particular, since most of the GRIND is about repetition anyway - there really has not been anything TRULY spoiler-worthy from this game in awhile...
Heck, other than going into the code to see/make-guesses about things - the only things ive written on spoilers-page are semi-obvious to anyone who plays consistently...
-----------
Arena-placement... Congrats !!! IIRC theres a google-play badge to be earned for first-place, but other than that i have never even broken top-100 in solo-modes... in alliance-mode, i DID manage to get within top-5 a number of times... in fact at the end of one EVENT awhile ago, i think we were ranked as second-place - which yielded a lot of prize-rewards, including a new (to me) character...
Currently, my goal is to grind-thru all the upgrades for all the characters and ships... on my ships, all T-1 and T-2 have full upgrades (evolutions AND levels) - and most T-3 are at T-2-max... on my crew, all T-1 and T-2 have full evolutions with half of the T-3 having T-2-max evolutions also... however, i have not generated enough dilithium crystals to level-up all the crew to complete their upgrades... also, in theory i could redo all the T-1 ships/crew to see if other-choices of powers/features would work better...
ive basically decided to wait a LONG while before trying to be competitive about arenas or events... for me it is about breadth, not depth, since i want to fill-out this wikia with at least a minimal/full set of stuff...
if you, or anyone, wants to go-deeper into any (or all?) crew/ship - thats awesome... heck, instead of (or alongside) a Trivia section - maybe there needs to be a Background section ? when i was making the character infoboxes, that background stuff was what i was thinking about for the item named aenu (ally, enemy, neutral, or unknown)...
...pauses... ...checks... oh boy, Terrhea...
would it be useful to have some more discussions about what/how you worked (or want to continue working?) on [[Terrhea]] ? im game... heck, at this point i am not sure if i got his gender correct... doh... :)
time for me to stop-babbling and let you chime in... cool ?

revision.comment: Created page with "since i mentioned this on my-wall, i will go ahead and describe the status of MY trying to get-everything... # - i have all of the characters and starships currently availabl..."
revision.text:
since i mentioned this on my-wall, i will go ahead and describe the status of MY trying to get-everything...
# - i have all of the characters and starships currently available (asof today that is 89 crew and 30 ships, 2018-01-01) # - every character and crewmember that i have obtained has been upgraded thru at least level-50... ## - upgraded means evolution PLUS levelling (i should start being more specific with my verbiage and fixup the glossary as well as older pages)... ## - evolution means that the hero/crew/ship CAN go up to a higher level... for instance EVERY item can go up to level-50 (tier-1-max) via the following rules... ### - for a tier-1 item it takes 10 evolutions to get to level-50 ### - for a tier-2 item it ALSO takes 10 evolutions to get to level-50 ### - but for a tier-3 item it only takes 3 evolutions to get to level-50... ## - levelling means that the hero/crew/ship DOES go up to a higher level... with the known maximum-levels of level-50 (for tier-1), level-95 (for tier-2), and level-165 (for tier-3)... # - all of my tier-2 characters have EVOLVED thru their maximum 15 evolutions, but none are levelled up to tier-2-max yet... (ie: no level-95 crew) # - only a couple of my tier-3 characters have EVOLVED thru their maximum 15 evolutions... about half of them have evolved thru to tier-2-max (level-96) ability; however none are levelled up to tier-2-max yet... (ie: no level-96 crew either) # - every starship that i have obtained has been upgraded more completely than the characters, due to being fewer in number... ## - all tier-1 ships upgraded thru level-50... ## - all tier-2 ships upgraded thru level-95... ## - all tier-3 ships have only been upgraded thru level-50, but some have been upgraded thru level-95/96 as well... ### - only one has enough evolutions for tier-3-max, but is still at tier-2-max level... ### - about half of the tier-3 ships have evolved thru tier-2-max and all of those ships have also been levelled-up to tier-2-max... # thus, for any ship that evolves to tier-2-max, i have been able to upgrade it completely as well... # lastly, i am trying to keep enough gold in my "bank" (10k-coins) to be able to purchase any new ships/crew as they become available... also, all new crew/ships have (so far) been tier-3 level in 2017... ## typically, the new items come in pairs (one TOS, one TNG)... ## typically, the new items cost about 4800 coins each via yellow-pack during their initial arena...

ok, so that post was not meant to be a brag - but rather a request for help...
if you have any characters and would like to add their listed-values from your game, please do so - either here, or add a comment to that character/starship page - so that it can be put into the data table...
in particular, if you have maxxed out anything - that is the MOST useful data to have... for tier-2, that means level-95 and for tier-3 that means level-165... also, for tier-1, maybe check to see if your numbers match up with mine...
tia, h.
eta: the easiest place to see all the useful pages is [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Template:TiermaxALL HERE]

due to the recent ship additions, ive decided to adjust some of the keys for the ships... in particular, i want to give the first-letter of each ship to their government... i had been semi-doing this, but i want to fixup the following:
hmmm - it looks like the only one i NEED to fixup to Timur, from TM to VTM...
for the moment im gonna ignore all the federation ones because that would conflict with ferengi (FDM dkora-marauder)...<ac_metadata title="renaming ship keys"> </ac_metadata>

files that needed fixing... * edit template:tiermaxALL * move SO/TM to SO/VTM eta: * edit module:starshipcodes/data * edit Timur eta2: * edit herotable * edit level50, level95, level165 - ignore because should autopopulate...

-- Module:ParsePN -- inside: [[Category:Modules]] using this line once...
-- <pre>
local p={}
local getargs = getargs or require('Dev:Arguments').getArgs local utils = utils or require('Module:Utilities') local glbls = glbls or require('Module:Globals') local comns = comns or require('Module:CommonCodes') local crews = crews or require('Module:Charactercodes') local ships = ships or require('Module:Starshipcodes') glbls.sorc = 'x' glbls.key = '' glbls.link = '' glbls.level = 0 glbls.tier = 0 glbls.upgr = ''
-- klugey, but workable... local namedUpgrades = { 'def','def','def', 'up10','up10', 'up03', 'up15','up09', 'up15', } local validLevels = { 1, 10, 40, 50, 50, 50, 95, 96, 165, } local maxLevels = { 50, 95, 165, } local validTiers = { 1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 3, }
function p._main(frame) -- this cleans up outside calls local a a = utils.tableShallowCopy(getargs(frame)) if #a == 0 then return false else glbls.args = a return true end end
local function passSorC(sorc) local fake = {} local retval = '' local check fake[1] = sorc if comns.passGLBLsorc(fake) then -- will not pass-up the GLBLs ftom below, -- but do hand-code of solution-wanted... retval = "it worked ? sorta..." glbls.sorc = string.upper(string.sub(sorc,1,1)) end check = glbls.sorc return retval..check end
local function getKey(sorc,key) local fake = {} local retval = '' local check fake[1] = sorc fake[2] = key check = comns.makeIGPTfromKey(fake) if check then retval = "it worked ... " glbls.key = key else check = '' end return retval..check end
local function mkLnkKey(sorc,key) local fake = {} local retval = '' local check fake[1] = sorc fake[2] = key check = comns.isGoodKey(fake) if check then retval = comns.getNamefromKey(fake) else retval = '.' end return retval end
local function getTier(sorc,key) local fake = {} local retval = '' local isOK = false local check,tempval,numTier fake[1] = sorc fake[2] = key fake[3] = 'tier' check = comns.isGoodKey(fake) if check then tempval = comns.getItemfromKey(fake) numTier = utils.toNum(tempval) if numTier > 0 and numTier < 4 then -- ick, hardcoded... retval = 'it worked... tier=' isOK = true -- hack for 3.5 tier if numTier == 3.5 then numTier = 3 end end retval = retval..numTier else retval = 'noTiernoKey' end -- make horrible, but necessary ? assumption for later... if not isOK then numTier = 1 end glbls.tier = numTier return retval end
local function mkLvlInfoBox(sorc,key,level) local fake = {} local retval = '' local check fake[1] = sorc fake[2] = key fake[3] = level -- check = crews.doLevelInfoBox(fake) if check then retval = comns.getNamefromKey(fake) else retval = '.' end return 'mkLvlInfoBox...'..retval end
local function checkPNok(tbl) -- this just check for 2 or 3 pieces in name... local isOK = false local retval = '' assert(type(tbl)=='table') if #tbl == 1 then retval = retval .. 'no slashes found in arg-1' return isOK,retval end -- next two are either Level/Key or just-Key if #tbl > 3 then retval = retval .. 'too many slashes found in arg-1' return isOK,retval end -- at this point... isOK = true retval = retval .. utils.dumpTable(tbl) return isOK,retval end
local function checkPNkey(tbl) -- this checks first/last pieces in name... local hasSorC,hasKey,isOK = false,false,false local retval = 'ckPNkey: ' assert(type(tbl)=='table') -- first is starship or character... sorc = tostring(tbl[1]) -- Key is always LAST... key = tostring(tbl[#tbl]) retval = retval..' sorc='..sorc -- side effect of passSorC() fills in glbls.sorc retval = retval..' PASSsorc='..passSorC(sorc) if glbls.sorc=='S' or glbls.sorc=='C' then hasSorC = true end retval = retval..' key='..key --retval = ' key='..key -- side effect of getKey() fills in glbls.key retval = retval..' GETkey='..getKey(sorc,key) if not utils.isBlank(glbls.key) then hasKey = true end -- at this point... if hasSorC and hasKey then isOK = true end -- side effect of getTier() fills in glbls.tier retval = retval..' GETtier='..getTier(sorc,key) --retval = ' GETtier='..getTier(sorc,key) tempstr = mkLnkKey(sorc,key) glbls.link = tempstr retval = retval..' MkLnkKey='..tempstr --retval = ' MkLnkKey='..tempstr -- retval = retval .. utils.dumpTable(tbl) return isOK,retval end
local function getUpgr() -- find magic-upgrade-string, using globals local gotit = false local ii,ij,ik local curval ii = glbls.tier curval = glbls.level -- magic math checking for 'perfect' level-template items... for i,v in ipairs(validTiers) do if v-ii == 0 then ij = validLevels[i] if curval-ij == 0 then gotit = true ik = i end end end -- at this point, resolve-inland-call... if gotit then glbls.upgr = namedUpgrades[ik] end return gotit end
local function checkPNvalid(tbl) -- this assumes that checkPNok completed... -- this assumes that checkPNkey completed... local hasLevel = true -- for 2-items... local isValid = false local retval = ' ckPNvalid: ' local tempstr, ok, begLv, endLv local level = tbl[2] local ell,found,xtra local bad1,gd2,gd3,bad4 = false,false,false,false assert(type(tbl)=='table') assert(#tbl>=2) assert(#tbl<=3) -- VALID path-split example: CO/L50/DE -- VALID path-split example: CO/DE -- CO means character (tos) -- L50 means need level-50 information -- DE means key into character-data... -- values T1=1, T2=10, T3=40 begLv = validLevels[glbls.tier] -- values T1=50, T2=95, T3=165 endLv = maxLevels[glbls.tier] if #tbl == 2 then glbls.level = begLv isValid = true retval = retval..' defLvl='..glbls.level return isValid,retval else hasLevel = false end -- BEGIN longer checks on middle-item... ell,found,xtra = string.match(level,'(%D*)(%d+)(.*)') if ell then retval = retval ..'ell:'..utils.dumpTable(ell) end if found then retval = retval ..'found:'..utils.dumpTable(found) end if xtra then retval = retval ..'xtra:'..utils.dumpTable(xtra) end -- return true,retval if ell and (#ell > 1) then bad1 = true end -- HARSH check on 'L' character... if not string.match(ell, '[lL]') then bad1 = true end if xtra and (#xtra > 0) then bad4 = true end if found then gd2 = true chkval = utils.toNum(found) if (chkval >= begLv) and (chkval <= endLv) then gd3 = true end end ok = true if bad1 or bad4 then retval = retval..'typo? >>'..level..'<<' ok = false end if not gd2 then retval = retval..'NOfinds? ' ok = false end if not gd3 then retval = retval..'choice?='..found..'? ' ok = false end if ok then isValid = true glbls.level = chkval retval = ' ckPNvalid:lvl='..glbls.level end return isValid,retval end
--[[
--]]
local function doSlash(args) local retval = 'doSlash: ' local tbl,ok,tempstr,argstr2 assert(type(args)=='table') tbl = mw.text.split( tostring(args[1]), "/" ) if #args == 2 then argstr2 = string.lower(args[2]) -- check the parsing details... ok,tempstr = checkPNok(tbl) retval = retval .. tempstr -- each return+retval is like a 'break' in the checks... if not ok then return retval end else -- #args <> 2 retval = 'doSlash: args .ne. 2 ...' return retval end retval = retval..'args:'..utils.dumpTable(args) --retval = 'args:'..utils.dumpTable(args) if argstr2=='isok' then retval = 'ok args' return retval end -- so far, args==2 and isOK -- check the key... ok,tempstr = checkPNkey(tbl) retval = retval .. tempstr --retval = tempstr if not ok then return retval end if argstr2=='getlink' and (#glbls.link > 1) then retval = glbls.link return retval end -- so far, isOK and gdKey -- check for valid level... ok,tempstr = checkPNvalid(tbl) retval = retval .. tempstr if not ok then --return tempstr --retval = 'doSlash: NOT valid level...' return retval end if argstr2=='isvalid' and (utils.toNum(glbls.level) > 0) then retval = 'valid Lvl-'..glbls.level return retval end -- so far, good-thru-level value -- pickup the upgrade-string... if argstr2=='getupgr' then if getUpgr() then retval = 'mk-'..glbls.upgr else retval = 'NOT an upgrade-level...' end return retval end -- nothing else to do ??? retval = 'DEBUG-uses only ... '..retval -- return retval end
local function TESTdoSlash(args) -- ALTERNATIVE would be to use utils.split_path() -- arg1 is input string -- arg2 is which piece to get... local tbl,tempval,tempstr local retstr = 'doSlash-tbd' -- i have no idea why these ENFORCED tonumber/tostring call reqd... -- retval = retval .. utils.dumpTable(a) -- tbl = mw.text.split( "this is a test", " " ) tbl = mw.text.split( tostring(args[1]), "/" ) -- tbl = mw.text.split( tostring(a[1]), "\\" ) -- retval = retval .. utils.dumpTable(tbl) -- tempval = utils.tonumber(a[2]) tempval = utils.toNum(args[2]) -- retval = retval .. tempval .. tostring(tbl[tempval]) retval = tostring(tbl[tempval]) tempstr = tbl[tempval] -- retval = tostring(utils.errBlank(tempstr,">><<")) -- retval = tostring(utils.errBlank(tempstr,"Err><")) retval = tostring(utils.errBlank(tempstr)) return retval -- return retstr end
function p.slash(frame) -- purpose: Parse the PAGENAME for slashes -- typical case: CO/L50/CK or SN/L165/SGZ -- local retval = 'invalid call to ParsePN-slash: ' local a,tbl,tempval,tempstr if not p._main(frame) then retval = retval..'zero arguments passed' return retval end a = glbls.args return doSlash(a) end
return p

revision.comment: Created page with "i imagine this thread asking (and possibly answering?) the general questions that go: what would happen if ... my first particular case, today, has to do with selling and th..."
revision.text:
i imagine this thread asking (and possibly answering?) the general questions that go: what would happen if ...
my first particular case, today, has to do with selling and then rebuying a ship...
my [[Enterprise B]] ship is currently at [[Level95|level 96]] from spending dilithium on it, however it is possible to be at [[Level165|tier-3-max]] because i have done all of the evolutions for it... it is one of the most-powerful ships in my inventory... however, it has STOPPED generating wins via the bug awhile ago...
while i have managed to accumulate a fair amount of spare dilithium/gold - i am by no means "rich"... not since my very-beginning stages of gameplay would i be as poor as i would be if i did the following...
WWHI ? - i upgraded my current Ent-B all the way up to level-165 and SOLD IT... ? my next step would be to re-purchase it (via the recruit button since it is currently an active arena) - and start over with upgrades...
would i be able to retrigger the very-useful BUG listed in the trivia-section ? would the server somehow remember/know that i had once-upon-a-time upgraded a ship to level-165 ? it seems to me that during arena-play, the server seems to know what the max-level of my character (or ship) is and so gives me enemies to fight that are just-at-my-limit...
one very-good reason for me to do this WWHI is that i could finally fill in the chart on [[Test Ship Level 3 type]] all the way... in particular, it would be useful to know when the other character/weapon slots become populate-able...
hopefully, there will not be any NEW characters/starships released in the next few weeks/months until i am able to re-accumulate some buffers... wish me luck ? :-)<ac_metadata title="what would happen if ... ? WWHI ?"> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "ok - currently, i am in the middle of the WWHI-process... specifically, my ENB is at lvl-163 and so i played a single tos-arena match using the ship... as most of yall know,..."
revision.text:
ok - currently, i am in the middle of the WWHI-process... specifically, my ENB is at lvl-163 and so i played a single tos-arena match using the ship... as most of yall know, the match was still based on my lvl-96-ish ship so it was against a lvl-93 iirc... thus, it was trivial to win... however, the server spent a bit of time on the initial battle-mechanics (probably updating my database with the fact that i now had a lvl-163 ship) and so my NEXT battle was against a lvl-161 ship... at that point, i stopped... im going to go back to finishing the upgrade process and then SELL the ship... sigh...
oh yeah, i just checked and my alliance/player-profile shows the lvl-163 ship now... iirc, the alliance/player-profile stuff gets updated pretty-much every time i play an event or arena battle with my latest choices... so hopefully, when i drop back-down post-sale - everything will reset correctly...

revision.comment: Created page with "ok - currently, i am near the end of the WWHI-process... specifically, ive sold-off my fully-equipped-ENB-lvl-165 which id been using to check on some of the later-calculatio..."
revision.text:
ok - currently, i am near the end of the WWHI-process... specifically, ive sold-off my fully-equipped-ENB-lvl-165 which id been using to check on some of the later-calculations for battling... before i sold it, i made sure that it would come back into my stable by purchasing the yellow-pack for the ENB-arena... sure enough, i received 3 ships along with a bunch of other stuff... none of the ships wouldve been useful (ie: could not upgrade due to max-evolution) so i felt comfortable selling...
sale price paid for the upgrades thru to lvl-50 again... so the last question will be how/what effect having played-matches using that ship will have... hopefully the server will just reset (twice) when i try battling the lvl-16x ship currently on-cue with a different l-96 ship... next, i will see if the battle will reset again based upon my l-50 ENB ship...

revision.comment: Created page with "wellp, im not sure when - but afaict the BUG on ENB has been fixed... since there have been at least two or more apk-releases since we had noticed the bug, it is not clear wh..."
revision.text:
wellp, im not sure when - but afaict the BUG on ENB has been fixed... since there have been at least two or more apk-releases since we had noticed the bug, it is not clear whether it was quashed coincidentally or purposely... my current ENB is sitting at lvl-51 and i have not been able to trigger the bug with several rounds of play... unfortunately, since my highest-ship is around lvl-96 now (in TOS and TNG) i keep losing trophy-points if i use the weaker ship to play against the now-default lvl-96 opponents... at least, afaict, the scan (by the server) was done correctly and when i sold the lvl-165 ship - it dropped my play-level back down...
sigh - now im back to the approx-lvl-95 series of upgrades that i was grinding thru for all of the heros... slowly but surely, i guess, i will fill in all of the data needed... it sure would be easier if some folks who had lvl-165 (for instance) characters or ships - could chime in and supply some data... oh well... have fun, h.
{{Level165}}
{{Level95}}

-- inside: [[Category:Modules]] using this line once...
-- Unit tests for [[Module:ParsPN]]. Click talk page to run tests. local p = require('Dev:UnitTests') local glbls = require('Module:Globals')
local fail00 = 'invalid call to ParsePN-slash: zero arguments passed' local fail01 = 'doSlash: no slashes found in arg-1' local fail02 = 'doSlash: args .ne. 2 ...' local fail04 = 'doSlash: too many slashes found in arg-1' local fail05 = 'doSlash: NOT valid level...' local fail06 = 'NOT an upgrade-level...'
local failXXX = 'DEBUG-uses only ... ' local failZ6 = 'doSlash: { [1] = CO,[2] = ' local failZ4 = ',[3] = CK,} ' local failZ3 = 'args:{ [1] = CO/' local failZ1 = '/CK,[2] = isvalid,} ' local failY5 = 'ckPNkey: sorc=CO PASSsorc=it worked ? sorta...C' local failY4 = ' key=CK GETkey=it worked ... kirk-1' local failY3 = ' GETtier=it worked... tier=1' local failY2 = ' MkLnkKey=[[Captain Kirk]]' local failX1 = ' ckPNvalid: ' local xxx01 = 'ell:Lfound:00xtra:choice?=00? ' local xxx02 = 'ell:L-found:1xtra:typo? >>L-1<<' local xxx03 = 'ell:Xfound:1xtra:typo? >>X1<<' local xxx04 = 'ell:XXXfound:1xtra:typo? >>XXX1<<' local xxx05 = 'ell:Lfound:51xtra:choice?=51? ' local xxx39 = ' ckPNvalid:lvl=39'
local failYY = '/CK,[2] = tbd...,} ' local failY1 = failYY..failY5..failY4..failY3..failY2 local failX2 = failZ1..failY5..failY4..failY3..failY2 local failX3 = failZ4..failZ3
function p:test_slash_args() self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash }}', fail00) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | xxxxx }}', fail02) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | xxxxx | isok }}', fail01) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/ | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | /bbb | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | /bbb/ | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | //ccc | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | // | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb/ccc | isok }}', 'ok args') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb/ccc/ddd }}', fail02) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb/ccc/ddd | isok}}', fail04) end
function p:test_slash_XXXvalids() self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00/CK | isvalid }}', failZ6..'L00'..failX3..'L00'..failX2..failX1..xxx01) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L-1/CK | isvalid }}', failZ6..'L-1'..failX3..'L-1'..failX2..failX1..xxx02) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/X1/CK | isvalid }}', failZ6..'X1'..failX3..'X1'..failX2..failX1..xxx03) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/XXX1/CK | isvalid }}', failZ6..'XXX1'..failX3..'XXX1'..failX2..failX1..xxx04) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L51/CK | isvalid }}', failZ6..'L51'..failX3..'L51'..failX2..failX1..xxx05) end
function p:test_slash_AAAdebug() -- self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L39/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L39/CK | tbd... }}', failXXX..failZ6..'L39'..failX3..'L39'..failY1..xxx39) end
--[[
function p:test_slash_debugs() self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/ | getLink }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | /bbb | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | /bbb/ | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | //ccc | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | // | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb/ccc | isvalid }}', 'debug') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/LMNOP/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00/AK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00/CCP | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') end
function p:test_slash_longs() self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/AK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/CCP | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L00001/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/M1/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L33/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L50/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L95/CK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L50/AK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L95/AK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L96/AK | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L50/CCP | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L1/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L40/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L50/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L96/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | CO/L165/ANU | tbd... }}', 'debug-Level') end function p:test_slash_oks2() self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb }}', fail02) self:preprocess_equals('{{#invoke:ParsePN | slash | aaa/bbb/ccc }}', fail02) end
--]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Oh, bummer !!! The truth is "No, sorry, I cannot help." The reason is: I am in no way associated with the official game - this is only a FAN website, which I am creating/mai..."
revision.text:
Oh, bummer !!! The truth is "No, sorry, I cannot help."
The reason is: I am in no way associated with the official game - this is only a FAN website, which I am creating/maintaining...
To my knowledge, the actual developers of the game are basically silent - although it might not hurt to try contacting them...
I, too, have often made mistakes (accidentally by myself -or- accidentally by technology) and been sad about it. I can only suggest that of the many mistakes that happen in life - to have lost some prizes inside this game is a minor one...
Also, sometimes, I have gotten lucky with this game... For instance, when I am on the screens (at the end of an event) that ask you to confirm/accept the prizes - sometimes I just close them with the X, rather than hitting OK/Confirm... Almost always, the prizes have actually been given to me anyways... Or, if my phone battery runs out in the middle of a battle - the system does not assume that I lost (or won) - so I am able to play it again when the phone recharges...
Maybe you will be lucky and discover that you actually DID receive the prizes... Let me know if you did, so I can be happy for you too...
Again, I am sorry that this is not an official way to contact any of the developers or owners or maintainers of the actual game...
Sincerely, H.Felton
ps - If you wait until either the Beginners or Legendary common-objective prizes become available, then try again !!! Maybe you will be lucky and be able to collect one of them also/instead... In particular, we can wait until Wednesday (5 days from now) to see if the Legendary prizes become available...
pps - Welcome to this website - and I wish you lots of luck as you play this game... :-)

ETA - if you would like me to remove your name/group from your original message, then please feel free (or ask me - and i can do it)... h.
ETA2 - i can do things on this website only - but the game, itself, is controlled somewhere else (by someone else)... :( h.

revision.comment: Created page with "i just checked into this-cycle's event and sure-enough, all three of the common-goals were reached ! yay... the event is scheduled to end [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Star_..."
revision.text:
i just checked into this-cycle's event and sure-enough, all three of the common-goals were reached ! yay... the event is scheduled to end [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Star_Trek_Wrath_of_Gems_Wikia:Calendar/2018-02-07 then], so this is fairly early for all the prizes to be available...
in particular, i was able to retrieve all 3 sets of prizes - rather than just one set (as mentioned in the Trivia-section of [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Events_in_general#.27Thermometer.27_Prizes here])...
after having several rounds of events with not-great attendance towards the end of last year, it is nice to see the recent upsurge... of course, the Missing-event is usually the easiest event to succeed at the common-objectives in-my-experience - so we will see how the rest of this year shapes up...
have fun, h.<ac_metadata title="current event - common objectives COMPLETED..."> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "There seems to be a bug with some of the newer weapons that they're trying to fix. If you get the Vulcan, Ferengi, or Borg weapons from the packs, they disappear before they g..."
revision.text: There seems to be a bug with some of the newer weapons that they're trying to fix. If you get the Vulcan, Ferengi, or Borg weapons from the packs, they disappear before they get into inventory. You have to send a message through the in-game "Customer Support" telling them what you got from the pack(s) and that they're not in your weapons list.

getting customer-support for the weapons... geez - i dont know how many of these ive received (and lost) over the past few months... i did take some screenshots at the time - just for this website, which i havent uploaded... and could confirm the red/green spellings (and caps-issue)... i still havent seen the white item yet...
overall, i just assumed that they might get around to fixing things - or not - and that it wasnt too critical... but thanx for the comment - i might have to go and try that... i know i was/am quite pleased to have gotten at least one-of-each of the vulcan items - altho since that initial success, i have still been losing items there also...
ETA: just now, i lost another vulcan-shield (took a screenshot) and wondered -where- the in-game customer support is located... im guessing that maybe it must be on facebook ? idk...

interestingly, the FIRST time you (anyone) writes to them using the gear-thingie - the screen is different than what i see now, after already having had a conversation with them... i was gonna try to get over to document that, but have just been sidetracked... thanx for the reminder...

revision.comment: Created page with "How can I know if I am going to be able to collect the Common objective prizes or not? Is it all-or-nothing? I read something about a mind meld when clicking the thermometer b..."
revision.text: How can I know if I am going to be able to collect the Common objective prizes or not? Is it all-or-nothing? I read something about a mind meld when clicking the thermometer bar, but while the event is still ongoing at least, nothing happens when I do that. I really want the Salt Vampire offered in Normal event for common objective prizes! Thanks for any info.

revision.comment:
Created page with "
How can I know ...
several ways: 1) i just checked the current [[Isolated Station]] event and the answer (with 1d 17h left to completion) is NO... s..."
revision.text:
How can I know ...
several ways: 1) i just checked the current [[Isolated Station]] event and the answer (with 1d 17h left to completion) is NO... sorry... 2) you read correctly, and tried correctly in-game... yes, it is basically all-or-nothing... when you click on the thermometer-bar, at the bottom - on the next screen (with the prize-listings), the COLLECT button will be bright-yellow (not dim, like it is right now)... also, the red-X at the top-right will disappear - so you will be unable to leave the screen without clicking on that bright-yellow-COLLECT-button... 3) before entering the screen by clicking on the thermometer - you can look closely at the numbers and color on that yellow bar... a) there are two numbers, separated by a slash, which for me read as follows: NORMAL - 80,232,132 / 140,000,000 ... once the first-number gets higher than 140,000,000 then you can collect... b) the bar, itself, is bright-yellow (from left - to around halfway along) and then dim-yellow: and once the whole bar is bright-yellow you can collect... -------- after that one event back in february, i have not seen any of the events actually fill up the common-objectives again... i guess the game is not as popular as it was last year... we can all do our little part to try and make the thermometer complete - by playing the missions and getting more and more points... as far as getting the [[Salt Vampire]] - if you have not yet received one from the luck-of-the-draw (using the blue/red/yellow packs), then just try to be patient... since she is a tier-2 character, just keep cranking along and getting as many packs as possible... eventually, you should get lucky (from the packs) and receive one... another option - if you see an alliance on the top-alliances page, that has an empty slot - try to join it... the salt-vampire is also a prize that you could win if your alliance is between 11th to 20th place in the legendary rankings at the end of this cycle... i personally, would not recommend spending gold to purchase generic red or yellow-packs... however, if you DO have an abundance of gold (or crystals) you might try spending some on the packs... idk... i know that when i was in the earlier-stages of my gameplay, i DID blindly purchase some of the red or yellow packs just to hopefully get a character that would increase my current inventory or team... the blue-packs were rarely useful tho - so it was (and still is) almost always about making/using gold pieces... good luck, h.

ps - you DO have to hit that collect button while the event is ongoing... once the event finishes, you cannot get inside it to test the thermometer bar... thus, it might be worthwhile to set an alarm and check the status right before (maybe 1-2 hours) the event is scheduled to end...
i have noticed that if you wait TOO close to the end (like 5 minutes), you might get locked out... there will be more-than-usual traffic to the company-website and you can get frustrated quite easily... i find that i can usually tell if the thermometer will be full, just by doing a couple of samples during the last 12-24 hours...
if i am around/available, i wil try to remember to mention whether i see the thermometer as being full... but it will still be up to YOU to go inside the game and click on it to COLLECT... :)
ETA: pps - if i had to guess, i doubt that it will get full before the end this time - but maybe i will be proven wrong...

revision.comment: Created page with "Thanks! I really appreciate the thorough explanation and tips!! It’s too bad the common objective prizes depend on all collective users’ play. I would guess it would be mo..."
revision.text: Thanks! I really appreciate the thorough explanation and tips!! It’s too bad the common objective prizes depend on all collective users’ play. I would guess it would be more motivational to keep players playing if it were based on your alliance play and actually attainable. I want this game to work and be a success-—I love the art and varied boards—-but I’m sure it’s the high cost to win that is discouraging more gameplay. I don’t even want to recommend it to my Trekkie friends because I know they would think I was crazy. They’re not as patient as me. I don’t mind supporting the devs team by making occasional purchases over a year, but I don’t want to spend more than $50 a year on one game that is nothing as detailed as a PS4 game costing the same up front. I’ve strategically leveled up my best characters and ships with about $25, so grinding is easier and wins are more attainable, and then will work on collecting what I most want for fun. Thanks again for taking the time to answer my Qs!

revision.comment:
Created page with "
Thanks again for taking the time to answer my Qs!
youre very welcome... that (helping others) is why i started this fandom site... otoh, 'that' (n..."
revision.text:
Thanks again for taking the time to answer my Qs!
youre very welcome... that (helping others) is why i started this fandom site... otoh, 'that' (not-willing-to-recommend) is why there is basically noone here except me (and other crickets)... :-) really, this game is workable for some entertainment - but it is NOT in most ways something i would consider FUN... personally, i must admit i have not been willing to actually spend any real-$ because it did not seem wise... otoh, i DO watch the silly roulette-wheel advertisements - which seems like a wiser way (to me) to support them... the ads support them, and the prizes support me... however this means that it takes a REALLY long time to grind up... but i have a surprising amount of patience... there is another game that i used to play a lot more at [[w:c:dwlegacy:category:premium Content|Doctor Who Legacy]] where i was actually willing to spend real-$ (and did) over time... in fact, i would even recommend that game to others on occasion... like you, only a few $10's of dollars seemed reasonable... i think that over the years i probably did sink in closer to $100 because it was/is FUN... at a minimum, i felt it was important to tell people to pay-for and open their fan-area... as for you - if there are characters or ships that you really want, maybe we could come up with a cross-referencing system ? for instance, before you mentioned [[Salt Vampire]] - i had not realized that she was available as a legendary-team-award... usually, i find, that it is just easier to wait the weeks/months until the character/ship shows up in an arena - or for sale in the archive... at this point i do have all of the ships and characters (to date), but must admit that i have not actually tried to play them all yet... that (trying all the characters) is something that i probably should do - especially since some of them are still showing weird broken-translations for their english-powers, last i checked... i typically choose my teams by looking at what other top-players are using... that usually gives me enough of a baseline to sort out WHY they chose those characters, and what i can add/change (if anything) to suit my style of play... anyways - it was nice chatting with you... with less than 20 hrs left in the cycle for this event - the EASY common-prize is at 38.7/50.M, the NORMAL (which you wanted) is at 84.3/140.M, and the LEGENDARY is at 137.6/220.M - so if i had to guess, none of them will make it to full... iirc, the easy-prize will get pretty close (maybe 45/50 = 90%) like the last-cycle... sorry... who knows, tho, i will play a bit more myself (in yellow/normal) and maybe itll help... gl, h.
