-- eventdates module -- inside: [[Category:Modules]] using this line once... -- replaces the template_event-text-01 (limit of 9-ish dates) -- also is the central holding place for when each event occurred...
-- <pre>
local p = {} local getargs = getargs or require('Dev:Arguments').getArgs local utils = utils or require('Module:Utilities') local glbls = require('Module:Globals')
-- semi-dummy statement because 'out' is going to hold the final html-object... glbls.out = true glbls.data = {} glbls.dbg = false
-- local EventSeq = { 'eom', 'ad', 'is', 'eeq', 'ms', } -- events in sequence 1..5 local EventSeq = { 'eom', 'ad', 'vi', 'is', 'eeq', 'ms', } -- events in sequence 1..6
local EventNames = { -- abbr to actual-names eom = 'Empty of the Mind' , ad = 'Adrift' , vi = 'Virus' , is = 'Isolated Station' , eeq = 'Event-Equilibrium' , ms = 'Missing' , -- catchall-bad (numeric-key vs. alphabetic) 'Unnamed Event' , }
local EventDates = { -- abbr to known-dates eom = { '2017-01-11', '2017-04-05', '2017-07-19', '2017-11-01', '2018-02-07', '2018-04-04', '2018-06-27', } , ad = { '2016-11-23', '2017-04-26', '2017-08-09', '2017-12-13', '2018-02-21', '2018-05-02', '2018-08-08', } , vi = { '2018-05-16', '2018-07-11', } , is = { '2017-02-01', '2017-05-17', '2017-08-30', '2017-11-22', '2018-03-07', '2018-04-18', '2018-07-25', } , eeq = { '2017-02-22', '2017-06-07', '2017-09-20', '2018-01-03', '2018-05-30', '2018-08-22', } , ms = { '2017-03-15', '2017-06-28', '2017-10-11', '2018-01-24', '2018-03-21', '2018-06-13', '2018-09-05', } , 'generic date = ccYY-MM-dd' , }
local function mkTable(inpT,hdrT,flgT) local retOut,inputTable,headerTable local rowHdr,rowDat local miniTbl = {} local chkHdrs local hdrSzs = { 10, 30, 50, } local possFlags = { "flgClass", "flgAutoNumRows", "flgHeaderDetails", } local dbgOut = '

'
retOut = mw.html.create('table') retOut:attr( 'border', '1')
-- check and DO the flag-Table for _,flg in ipairs(possFlags) do if flg == 'flgClass' then -- override class for options like 'wikitable sortable' if utils.isNotBlank(flgT[flg]) then retOut:addClass(flgT[flg]) else retOut:addClass('articletable') end end if flg == 'flgHeaderDetails' then -- only deal with one-item... if utils.isNotBlank(flgT[flg]) then chkHdrs=true table.insert(hdrSzs,1,10) else chkHdrs=false end end if flg == 'flgAutoNumRows' then -- adjust headerTable for first-column-numbering... if utils.isNotBlank(flgT[flg]) then local nr = 0 table.insert(hdrT,1,"###") -- THEN adjust inputTable for first-column-numbering... -- require inpT to have UNnamed rows of table-data... for k,v in ipairs(inpT) do nr = nr + 1 table.insert(v,1,nr) miniTbl[k] = utils.tableShallowCopy(v) end -- overwrite original... inpT = miniTbl end end end headerTable = utils.tableShallowCopy(hdrT) inputTable = utils.tableShallowCopy(inpT)
-- once flags are done, do the headers... if glbls.dbg then dbgOut = '

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'begin-dbgOut... 

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'flag-Table is 

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. utils.dumpTable(flgT) ..'

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'header-Table is 

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. utils.dumpTable(hdrT) ..'

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'hdrSzs-Table is 

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. utils.dumpTable(hdrSzs) ..'

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'input-Table is 

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. utils.dumpTable(inpT) ..'

' dbgOut = dbgOut .. 'end-dbgOut... 

 ' end -- HeaderDetails include formatting, sizing, etc. ??? rowHdr = mw.html.create('tr') -- for _,hdr in ipairs(headerTable) do for hdr = 1, #headerTable do local FmtHdr FmtHdr = utils.TitleCase(headerTable[hdr]) -- FmtHdr = hdr:upper() -- FmtHdr = hdr:lower() -- if i try to break-out the rowHdr props, it fails... if chkHdrs then rowHdr :tag('th') :wikitext(FmtHdr) :attr('scope','col') :css('width',tostring(hdrSzs[hdr])..'%') :done() else rowHdr :tag('th') :wikitext(FmtHdr) :attr('scope','col') -- :attr('data-sort-type','numeric') -- :css('width','50%') :done() end end retOut:node(rowHdr) -- once headers are done, do the actual rows... for k,v in ipairs(inputTable) do local subTbl, subStr if type(v) == 'table' then local rowDat = mw.html.create('tr') for dat = 1, #v do if type(v[dat]) == 'table' then subTbl = v[dat] subStr = utils.dumpTable(subTbl) else subStr = tostring(v[dat]) end rowDat :tag('td') :wikitext(subStr) :done() end retOut:node(rowDat) end end retOut:node(rowHdr) -- retOut:done() -- returning... if not glbls.dbg then return retOut else return dbgOut end end
local function mkIndex() local retstr = '
' -- for k,v in pairs(EventDates) do -- this runs in n-squared time... for i,a in ipairs(EventSeq) do for k,v in pairs(EventNames) do -- skip the unnamed-events... if type(k) == 'string' then if a==k then retstr = retstr..tostring(i)..' - ' retstr = retstr..'[['..tostring(v)..']]'..'

' retstr = retstr.. utils.dumpTableSorted(EventDates[k]) ..'

' end end end end return retstr end
--- hello-world to setup testcases correctly... function p.main(frame) local a = getargs(frame) glbls.data = utils.tableShallowCopy(a) local what = a[1] local out,hold local tempstr='' if what=='index' then out = mkIndex() elseif what=='count0' then out = tostring(#EventSeq) elseif (what=='Events') or (what=='EventsDebug') or (what=='EventsAddRowNums') then if what=='EventsDebug' then glbls.dbg = true end local iT,hT,fT local junkStr if what=='EventsAddRowNums' then fT = { flgClass='wikitable, sortable', flgAutoNumRows='true', flgHeaderDetails='true',} else -- fT = {} fT = { flgClass='wikitable', flgHeaderDetails='true',} end hT = { 'abbr', 'name', 'datesList', } iT = {} for seq = 1,#EventSeq do local abr = EventSeq[seq] iT[seq] = { abr, EventNames[abr], EventDates[abr], } end -- iT = { { 'ev9', 'event Nine', {'dt9', 'dt8', 'dt7',}, }, -- { 'ev4', 'event Four', {'dt2', 'dt3', 'dt4',}, }, -- { 'ev5', 'event Five', {'dt5', 'dt6', 'dt7',}, }, -- { 'ev1', 'event One', {'dt0', 'dt1', 'dt2',}, }, -- } out = mw.html.create() hold = mkTable(iT,hT,fT) -- junkStr = addParagraph('junk Paragraph...') -- out:node(junkStr) -- out:node(junkStr) out:node(hold) -- out:node(junkStr) else out = "Hello, world! - doing..."..tostring(what).. "... with ==>"..utils.dumpTable(glbls.data) end return tostring( out ) end
return p

revision.text:
@Hfelton, I see you are only one who has made some post regarding this game in "ages". Do you know if this game is still updated/bugs fixed etc. or have devs abandoned the game completely as these common objectives are not adjusted at all to be even remotely possible to complete.
Also, just some time ago managed to purchase this Vulcan ship, but all the lasers/shield bank I got from packs, just vanished. Is it even possible to upgrade that ship?

revision.comment: Created page with "howdee @aFandomUser and welcome ! yes, believe it or not, the game (and devs) DO update and try to fix things... the COMMON OBJECTIVES values have not been adjusted in awhil..."
revision.text:
howdee @aFandomUser and welcome !
yes, believe it or not, the game (and devs) DO update and try to fix things... the COMMON OBJECTIVES values have not been adjusted in awhile (were they ever? idk) - and they are set fairly high for the level of current common-gameplay... i HAVE seen some updates on subtle issues like the number-of-players who can receive rewards (via [[Events_in_general#Ranking_Prizes]] updated from 5000 to 10000 awhile ago) so i know that they (devs) are watching...
the vulcan ship/s (see [[Weapons]] page and its discussion at bottom) are indeed an issue... you should send an in-game message to get any lost or missing weapons restored (see [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Questions#Q_by.2Fabout_Playing HERE]) and then keep RE-sending NEW-msgs of lost-items as the issue keeps happening... THAT bug is a tough-one for them, id imagine... tbh - once i had filled up (upgraded) the ships to my current satisfaction, i have not seen any further issues... i have probably sent 5+ messages (over 1+ months) just so you know, but i DO still keep an eye out for the problem...
as long as the company continues to make some money from the game - they will continue to support it, afaict... those little in-game advertisements (roulette-wheel) are definitely one way they make money... and over the couple of years i have been playing, they have definitely released some new-content and fixed some-bugs... however i would say that this game is in more of a maintenance-mode rather than in active-development-mode; but i cannot be sure - and rolling out changes on a currently-running-system can-be (and oftentimes-IS) problematic...
hth, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "Hi All, This seems to be the only place where it seems I find anyone discussing this game. Does anyone have more information about what’s upcoming in the game? I updated th..."
revision.text:
Hi All,
This seems to be the only place where it seems I find anyone discussing this game. Does anyone have more information about what’s upcoming in the game? I updated the game through the iOS App Store 2 weeks ago (April 2018), and the update mentioned the following:
New Event: Virus
New Characters: 7 for TNG
New Races: Tychon, Veua & Andorian
That’s what I could glean from the update. Does anyone know when this actually supposed to start? Or is this even happening? Is there a place to find out news about the game?
Just curious to see if anyone knows more. Thanks.
—missbear71<ac_metadata title="STWOG Update in App Store April 2018 - New Event/Characters Coming?"> </ac_metadata>

gaak
eta - i had this nice long post with links and whatnot that i apparently just barfed-away... sigh... will try again in abit...
btw - welcome missbear71 !

simple-rewrite of prior-lost-post:
i do not know anything particularly new or different than any other user... for instance, on reddit ([https://www.reddit.com/r/StarTrekWrathofGems/comments/6cbwet/new_starshipscharacters/ HERE]) from last year, the first-row of chars/ships have indeed been added to the game... on this website, ive tried to track changes i notice on [[Star Trek Wrath of Gems Wikia:Spoilers]] but havent noticed anything new recently...
if anyone has some historical-info from the earlier-days of this game, i/we can add it to the data... but for now, most characters/ships/events i generally show added-on 2015-01-01 ... for instance on [[Ensign Chekov]] vs. [[Cmdr. Chekov]] - if you expand the aenu-arrow of the info-box, youll see i noted the cmdr as 2017-08-22 instead... anyways, other than occasional mistakes (like last-year) or minor sneak-peaks (upcoming events/arenas) - i have no FUTURE info...
hth, h.
eta: as far as NEWS, i suspect genera has this game in more of a maintenance-mode rather than active-development... but i have no proof or info to support that assessment either... they (genera) DO react quite promptly to in-game customer support (which is great) for any [[weapons]] issues...

WOW, you made something happen !?!? It looks like the next event will be titled Virus and feature an Adoran (or whatever the blue-race was called, im typing from bed)... If we are lucky, there might even be a new character (or two+?) to be purchased/recruited... the event is showing as TNG, and presumably will start in a week or so...

like that old joke that asks "how do you get your food to be served faster ? just leave to go to the restroom..." - apparently the next new thing from the game was just raring to go... :-)

too funny, i was going to check on the list-of-pages to change from jan23rd and apparently the system only holds info back to jan27th (as of today, may15th) so pulling down history can be a bit challenging sometimes... sigh...
anyways, lets just try and summarize again based upon notes up above... # Decide on their name and their 2-3 letter key, and document that at [[Hero table]] ## today im adding MEL for [[melea]] the newly-available TNG-char... ## also, im setting up info for BRU, NVZ, TYD, TYL, and TYM since theyll be coming in soon... ## the important detail about the KEY is to not accidentally be a repeat - keys should be unique (at least across chars/ships and preferably across both)... # The next important step is to add some basically-empty info into the [[Module:Charactercodes/data|character database]] (or the [[Module:Starshipcodes/data|starship database]]) ## at the top of each db, named aaaaDEFAULT or similar, is a fully-filled-in fake character (or ship) for each of the three-tiers... or just copy an example from up above in this thread - to get started... ## once the database has been saved with the new key/name added, then go ahead and check that it (the db) is working correctly by going to the [[CrewAll]] page... ## turns out that the igp-item is/was necessary otherwise crewall doesnt populate correctly... once it DOES populate, we can see that the photos i uploaded are working and we have some nice red-links that need to be filled in... # fill in the following red-links... ## column-1, [[CN/MEL]] which is just a redirect to the full-name [[melea]] ## column-3, [[melea]] which i just copied the callouts from any other tier-3 char... don't forget to find/lookup the memory-alpha links for the characters/ships...
---- stopping for now...
# ok - now lets make the MANUAL modifications to the [[template:TiermaxALL]] page...
#redirect [[melea]]

once the event ([[Virus]]) went live, we got a new [[Recruit Area]] link that allowed all the 6 new tychon and veau characters - as well as one new andorian character - to be purchased (if lucky)... thus, adding to [[Hero table]] the [[CN/TZZ]] and [[thira zh'Zoarhi]] key/name...
it turns out that while the other two races are new for this game, the andorians are a well-established race... since this sequence is from the [[TNG]] era, we will have a useful/valid Memory-Alpha link for the character...
these new changes are kinda exciting for now... :-)

revision.comment: Created page with "the event has been ongoing for its first-week-rollout, and the blankish elements for all 7 new chars were added... the next important thing to do (before the stopping-msg and..."
revision.text: the event has been ongoing for its first-week-rollout, and the blankish elements for all 7 new chars were added... the next important thing to do (before the stopping-msg and tiermaxall-stuff above) is/was to add them (new chars) to the navbox ([[Template:Characters Navbox]] aka {{T|Characters Navbox}})...

As mentioned [http://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:1420 HERE], we got a new [[:Category:Events|Event]] called [[Virus]] this week (2018-mid-may)... It is a [[TNG]] event and introduces lots (7) of new-playable characters... Thus, there are now 6 events, and I added this one in-the-middle (after [[adrift]]) so the text on the Events-page which describes them in-numerical-order needs to be rewritten/adjusted...
Once the event, itself, has completed - hopefully we can get the ordering and history loaded up correctly... :) h.

Alternatively, maybe you just want the primary-page of [[:Category:Tychon]]. [[Category:Tychon]] [[Category:Alien]]

revision.comment: Created page with "well, since the new characters were substantial additions - i ended up having to add/create a new category for each of the two races ([[Tychon]] and [[Veau]]) which then meant..."
revision.text:
well, since the new characters were substantial additions - i ended up having to add/create a new category for each of the two races ([[Tychon]] and [[Veau]]) which then meant a bunch of [[:Category:Disambiguations]] and adjusting of the overall [[Alien]] and [[:Category:Governments]] pages for consistency...
in particular, the [[Vulcan]] and [[Ferengi]] are pretty much full-fledged governments now that their [[Weapons]] are active on their ships...
while all this category-stuff is interesting, the reason to mention it here is because - as the actual page for a character is FULLY populated, it will also need to add its categories... typically, the categories are added at the bottom of the page in the semi-order of: # tng_crew or tos_crew (or _starship - NOT plain tng or tos category) # tier_number (twice if both 3 and 3.5) # government or race (this is still a bit in flux) # and finally, the 2 or 3 colors of the skills/features
i STILL have not gotten to the tiermaxall page, even tho a few of the characters have now been upgraded to their level-50 values...
thankfully, with a couple of yellow-packs, i was able to purchase all of the characters and so can fill in their data (if i am careful before upgrading or leveling them up)...
ttfn, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "jic anyone has bookmarked this page for event-news... im going to PREDICT that the common objectives for the currently running (and NEW) event [[Virus]] will be collectable i..."
revision.text:
jic anyone has bookmarked this page for event-news... im going to PREDICT that the common objectives for the currently running (and NEW) event [[Virus]] will be collectable in a day or two...
atm the storyline has not even finished (the last level will release in an hour) and the hard-sequence has not even shown up on my screen as to-be-playable (usually it shows up during todayf)...
however, the scoring is VERY-weird on the event and because of all the new characters and possibilities - there is surely some in-game excitement driving up the thermometers...
thus, i am posting the message NOW to give you ample warning - watch the thermometer and be very careful about whether you want to go inside the window... remember, unless you shutdown your game (on the phone) externally - once the thermometer is FULL you will be forced to collect that exact prize screen to move forward....
to document, with 7+ DAYS to go, the [[Events in general]] Thermometer prizes are currently showing mostly-full:
scores: EASY 23.0/35.M, NORMAL 52.4/65.M (which will allow collecting one of the new characters - which is probably why it is so-close...)
again: remember, you might want to wait for the LEGENDARY thermometer - which has not even been revealed yet... gl, h.

revision.text:
with several days left - all three common-objectives are completed on the latest (and NEW) [[Virus]] event... if you collect the legendary (if available to you) items FIRST you can get both [[Ty'dollus]] and [[Navzar]]... then, if you are lucky and go directly to the other collections - you can get a second [[Navzar]] from the normal event, and a few more coins and stuff from the easy event...
good luck - and enjoy... h.

Anyone know a good place to recruit alliance members?

revision.text:
An Fandom-user asked:
Anyone know a good place to recruit alliance members?
over in a different thread [https://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:1365 HERE] and I do not have a good answer... Since I am pretty much the only one around here, and I am currently playing with an alliance, I cannot really answer this question... My hope, when starting THIS board, was to get folks to announce their alliances using the "ALL" tag... And, if that worked, then even have those folks be able to talk with-IN their alliance via their thread... I even started my own alliance for a bit, then gave up and joined someone elses... I could make all kinds of hypotheticals (read: guesses); but the truth is that i do not know... So - how would YOU answer the question ?

howdee and welcome aboard !!! i created a separate thread [https://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:1483 HERE] to try and answer that question (alliance conversations)... no one noticed it afaict... it is kinda lonely here... lol...
anyways, just checking in with the NOT-completed [[Empty of the Mind]] event numbers for today... EASY: 29.3/50.M, NORMAL: 72.9/140.M, and LEGENDARY: 138./220.M ... and another [[Virus]] event is right-on-its-heals to start in less than an hour... we will see if the new-event has any changes since its first run-thru...
enjoy, h.
{{Level95}}

i will be offline for the conclusion (next wed.) of the current [[Virus]] event... my prediction is that the NORMAL thermometer should fill up (since it is almost there already)... probably, the LEGENDARY will fill up also so keep your eyes on the prizes... gl, h.
eta/ps - apparently, normal and legendary DID fill up and easy is getting-close so go-get-em... EASY: 30.6/35.M , NORMAL: 70.5/65.M , LEGENDARY: 110.5/90.M ... hth, h

revision.comment: Created page with "How do I get Borg weapons for my Borg cube "
revision.text: How do I get Borg weapons for my Borg cube

borg weapons ARE much rarer to receive than some of the other govts weapons, but there are at-least two guaranteed spots and of course most-often the random spots that provide them...
guaranteed spots 1) in [https://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Missing#Scoring Missing-event] easy-mission-6, prize-1... AND 2) in [https://stwog.wikia.com/wiki/Virus#Scoring Virus-event] normal-mission-6, prize-2...
random spots - whenever you receive a PRIZE (see [[Currency]]) of either a RED or YELLOW pack, then the odds of receiving a Weapon are slim but non-zero... of course, you need a TNG-multi-pack since (iirc) BLUE has zero-percent weapons-drop and [[Borg]] is [[:Category:TNG]], but there-ya-go...
there might be other locations throughout the game that i missed, since i have not cross-indexed everything... but, as you can see, it takes a LOT of grinding to run the odds of getting a borg-weapon to occur... many of the other weapons are easier to receive (esp. from the roullette-wheel)...
hth, h.
ps - the DAILY-prizes also are a random-spot that sometimes dropped a weapon [again, iirc]... gl, h.
edits for formatting - probably could do better with wikilinks, but wth...
correction: [[Missing]] easy-BONUS-mission-11.5, prize-1 gives shield, and the other one gives pulse-cannon... sigh, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "correction-2: the random-multipacks will need to be PURCHASED using in-game coins/dilithium afaict... for instance, right now the only [[Recruit Area]] packs with weapons non..."
revision.text:
correction-2: the random-multipacks will need to be PURCHASED using in-game coins/dilithium afaict... for instance, right now the only [[Recruit Area]] packs with weapons non-zero percentages are for the [[Horizon]] and [[Tsiolkovsky]]... the [[Veau]] pack doesnt list weapons as possible-percentage-prizes... anyways - so right-this-moment, you would only be able (via RANDOM) to use the Tsiolkovsky-multipacks (TNG) to receive a borg-weapon... the prizes have a couple of default-values, but right-now it would be {{P|g|2500}} or {{P|g|4800}} to get a 5%/10% chance of a tng-weapon...
i do NOT know/remember if the packs-weapons are linked to the ship (ie: federation vs. borg) you purchase, but i doubt it - since im 90% sure that the randomness gives you various-govt-characters/ships (other than the semi-guaranteed ones of the specific multi-pack)... bleah - too many details, but there-ya-go... that is more-than-i-know... :) h.

revision.comment: Created page with "I've been playing from day 1, have every tier 3 character and starship fully evolved, have given at least an hour a day of my life, and now its ending?! "
revision.text: I've been playing from day 1, have every tier 3 character and starship fully evolved, have given at least an hour a day of my life, and now its ending?!

WOW - to the day-1 person, i think my daily prize-reward is in the 750+ area (ie about 2+ years)... if you HAVE played from day-1, what is your daily-prize-number ?
yeah - im bummed also... had been grinding along trying to finish off the tier-3 starships to get them evolved to L165-ability... altho i do not have enough dilithium to get them updated that high yet... my tier-3 characters were going to be the next-task to finish grinding...
as for why - i have no idea... i assume the folks in spain are just bored doing the maintenance on it... in theory they have to keep some servers running and maybe they are not recouping their costs from the ads... also, im fairly sure that they have to do most of their updates by-hand - and that is expensive salary-wise...
it is a strange problem - on the one hand, it is not too much work to keep something like this going... yet, OTOH, it is more work than nothing if it hasnt been automated enough...
i am also sad that the character of guinan was never introduced... but at least we got to see most of the other stuff mentioned on reddit [https://www.reddit.com/r/StarTrekWrathofGems/comments/6cbwet/new_starshipscharacters/ HERE]...
ETA: i will go ahead and create the stubs (manually) for all the L165 chars and ships... if someone has the info - go ahead and leave a comment on those pages, and ill put the data into the code itself...
specifically * the final-HP (ships and chars) * the final red-green-white bonuses (ships and chars) * the final gem-values (chars only)

revision.comment: Created page with "hey ho... just thought id go ahead and "out" myself... currently, this alliance is listed as #5 in the top-25... i am actually fairly far down (13/15) in the high-scores ..."
revision.text:
hey ho... just thought id go ahead and "out" myself...
currently, this alliance is listed as #5 in the top-25... i am actually fairly far down (13/15) in the high-scores there... also, i do not live in germany where the admin presumably does (or chose to declare when they created the alliance)...
i never did figure out how to contact my admin - but i DID notice that some of the other alliances would have an admin that created their username like an email address... that (username-as-email) seemed like a very good idea for communication purposes... in fact one alliance (forgotten now which one) that was fairly new to the top-8 was a PRIVATE alliance... i considered sending that admin an email (assuming their username-as-email existed) but i never did...
so - to the other members of THIS alliance - who i will (kinda) name below - id like to extend a friendly hello/hallo and thank you for the anonymous comraderie we shared... # STB... # Alex... # Tim R... # Mr.R... (admin) # Brad... # Tim H... # Nick... # Derek... # Mademoiselle... # Captain... # saluto... # p... # Harold Evo (me) # Blake... # chief...

revision.comment: Created page with "Yeah sorry man. Normally I am one of the people who helps drive that number towards completion, but it seems a bit pointless as it doesn't look like they are having anymore ev..."
revision.text: Yeah sorry man. Normally I am one of the people who helps drive that number towards completion, but it seems a bit pointless as it doesn't look like they are having anymore events or arena challenges. did you know that if you used the original bird of prey even if you were only a level 14 you could use his glitch to win on the legendary Park so you could get the coins? Yeah I found a bunch of glitches as able to exploit :-) would have shared it with you guys but I didn't even know there was a forum until after they shut down the game.

70.106.176.71 wrote: did you know that if you used the original bird of prey even if you were only a level 14 you could use his glitch
welcome - albeit during the farewell-season... :-) uhm - im not sure which [[Bird of Prey]] you meant here, since i never noticed any [[SO/ENB#Trivia|trivia]] for any-of-them... if you want, you could add a comment (or even edit the page directly) to whichever ship it was - and we could at least document it for posterity (and any other glitches youd like to share)... i was just trying to imagine how we could even USE the ships or characters for the next two-months thatre remaining for play... after tomorrow, i think we might be able to go back and replay some of the storyline - just to give our ships/chars some "exercise"... lol... ETA: heres the current values: EASY: 23.2/35.M ; NORMAL: 55.6/65.M ; LEGENDARY: 73.4/90.M ..

revision.comment: Created page with "Yellow: may look like a useless feature because you lose life points when you use it, but if you destroy your own ship using the yellow gem move you will destroy the other shi..."
revision.text: Yellow: may look like a useless feature because you lose life points when you use it, but if you destroy your own ship using the yellow gem move you will destroy the other ship no matter how many life points he has left and you will win. Yes then you have no life points on your ship and you have to wait for it to recharge but hey, still a pretty awesome feature.

revision.comment: Created page with "The biggest glitch of all, would be the one where if you're about to lose if you close out the game and open it back up you don't lose your life points on either the ship or t..."
revision.text: The biggest glitch of all, would be the one where if you're about to lose if you close out the game and open it back up you don't lose your life points on either the ship or the character depending on what you are playing. This is useful if you are playing the legendary event game and you get a bad case of "enemy disco ball fever" rendering you down to one person with 200 life points against three enemies with full life points. same with the ships you just have to close out before you get hit by that last shot that would blow up your ship; once that shot hits - you're dead.

revision.comment: Created page with "yeah - thats true (close out ahead-of-death), but idk if it was really that useful ? at least not in the events (as you just described), but i guess it would be QUITE useful ..."
revision.text:
yeah - thats true (close out ahead-of-death), but idk if it was really that useful ? at least not in the events (as you just described), but i guess it would be QUITE useful during the arena-battles... thats funny, i hadnt really thought about that...
specifically, i thought you only earned positive-trophies for completing event-levels each time... iirc, something like 15-easy, 25-normal, and 35-legendary... whereas during the arena-battles against other players - i found i would LOSE trophy-points (usu. -40) against opponents and would only regain positive trophy-points (+20, +10) after replaying/beating them... hmmm...
yeah - i guess that really is/was a very useful strategy... prolly should go document it at [[Strategy]] or someplace... lol... tyvm, h.

hmm - i think it WILL load (ie: run) if you do not need to fresh-install the game...
however, since the game was removed from play-store, then there is no place to get the APK (legally, and i do not know of illegal sources)... which (no APK) might explain why it does not seem to load...
anyways - sorry (to person who cannot get it to load)... gl, h.
ETA: there are lots of licensing-issues, so i imagine selling it is not really an option (nor would open-source, if i were to guess)... since Star-Trek (tm) and their characters are licensed only...

I was glancing thru the top-alliances and had to start laughing... several users had changed their names to some-variant of "Goodbye, and thanks for all the fish..." LOL...
also, i guess since there is no way to actually earn any more trophies - that our "final" score is set in stone... sigh...<ac_metadata title="Thanx for all the laughs..."> </ac_metadata>

btw - the last event came close, but did not break the common-goals thermometers (none of the 3)... the final prizes were awarded and nothing new seems to be listed...
i kinda wish that they had left their internal-shop open because i mightve tried buying some dilithium (and/or coins) to finish upgrading my tier-3 ships and chars... oh well...

P.s. I will never play Genera games again. Walter White

revision.comment: Created page with "WW: i totally understand (and share) your sadness and frustrations... and im assuming your last-sentence should be written in a sarcastic-font... yes, starting another game ..."
revision.text:
WW: i totally understand (and share) your sadness and frustrations... and im assuming your last-sentence should be written in a sarcastic-font... yes, starting another game from level-1 after having spent YEARS grinding is something i, too, would [sarcasm] love [/sarcasm] to do as well...
boycotting genera games might be a reasonable action, actually, altho i would not advocate doing so from THIS site - since this is supposed to be a fan-type of site... interestingly, i went over to the links on the front-page (for genera, etc.) and there was NO mention on their websites about this end-of-life... sigh...
also - welcome to the site... sorry it is under such sad circumstances... i wish that i had been able to collect all the tier-3 items and upgrade them all (because i am a completionist-type of person)...
feel free to vent (here, or anywhere else - via comments) - but im going to administratively stop the front-page from being defaced directly... sorry, but... im not fond of the cursing/language - so i will redact it from the main-page...
sincerely, h.

page.title: Talk:Star Trek Wrath of Gems Wikia

revision.text:
please add any further changes HERE - so i can make sure they are not TOO pejorative... thank you... harold (as a regular user, not an admin)... [[User:Hfelton2|Hfelton2]] ([[User talk:Hfelton2|talk]]) 06:41, September 21, 2018 (UTC)
== moving commentary... ==
this is the content from ip-addr [REDACTED] that was moved to protect the main-page:
<hr />Actually, the game is completely useless now because they cancelled any further "Events" or "Arena" cycles, and they've also removed any opportunity to buy character packs with in-game credits (other than the standard TOS and TNG pack sets, which are utterly useless if you already have your basic characters). In other words, they've fucked their fan base HARD, and without warning or any phase-out plan on 9/14/2018. Pretty shitty for those of us who have been building up characters for over 3 years... FUCK THE CUNNIES !!!
<hr />[[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 06:49, September 21, 2018 (UTC)
actually, i agree with you about the annoyance-level - but it could ALWAYS have been worse... so i did not feel the need to curse about it... at least i can ''sorta'' say goodbye... [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 06:52, September 21, 2018 (UTC)
Well folks, yes no cursing necessary, but how could it be worse?? They say we have 60 days to "play with the game", but there's no part of the game left to play!! I haven'thaven't bought any game credit recently, but what about customers who have?? What they've done is an abrupt shut off. What could be worse than that?!? 15:18, September 22, 2018 (UTC)[[Special:Contributions/24.96.140.104|24.96.140.104]]
== could be worse... ==
hmmm, for ME - it could be worse if they (as you said) had zeroed out all of my game-credits... specifically, the [[Currency]] that is/was equivalent to real-$$... since i am still interested in documenting the [[Level165]] pages, i would have had no way to finish any possible-upgrades/evolutions... atm, i ''only'' have {{P|d|908000|d}} and {{P|c|800|c}} which is not-enough to finish all the [[:Category:Tier 3]] ships (a/o chars) i didnt finish upgrading...
not to mention - they couldve killed ALL the servers right away... as it is, they have left some of the server-functionality intact... since im not in-the-know, i have no real idea what post-Nov-15th will look like... if we are lucky, there will be a way to at least boot-up the game to see some last-details, but idk [yet]...
of course, it COULD have been better if theyd warned us on Sep-14 (while removing the app from play-store), then had another [[Events]] (which would require a few more Arenas to keep the [[Alliances]] in-sync), and also kept their store open - while they wound the game down... ALSO - some way to xfer all the blood-sweat-tears to some other game of theirs might've been nice too... [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 17:26, September 22, 2018 (UTC)
I still don't understand your point. They DID the equivalent of rendering in-game or purchased "gold coins" useless. Even if you had alarge amount left (I have over 6000), you can no longer get any value out of it because there are no more chances to buy the specialty char/ship packs that you can only get from Arena and Event activities. And as the curser pointed out, though you CAN still buy standard TOS and TNG packs, they are useless to any player who has played over about a year, andwho already hashas the standard character ranks filled up. So yes, as you say, theyshould either REFUND the equivalent real $$$ that anyanyplayer has paid for credits in the past, corresponding to "gold coins" left over, or they should transfer some equivalent in-game value to another game.
Just to clarify my last point point further: Even if you had millions of gold coins left, if you have played the game for over about a year, those coins are now valueless to you now -- it IS in fact, just as if they had zeroed them out, as you put it.
[quote-ish] ...dont understand... [/q] so i will just concede... [sarcastic+resignation-font] thus i must agree, there is absolutely positively NO way that they could have handled things worse... [/font] sigh... [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 21:26, September 24, 2018 (UTC)
== what are you doing now ? ==
this is just a topic/thought i had... since the servers are still (barely) running - i was able to look thru some of the other alliance-members (and their stats)... i DID notice that someone has gone-back and (i assume) sold all their characters/ships and started the game over from zero...
<hr /> sidetrack...
but, i am actually not-sure about that... i actually never thought to check the server functionality for the following question: if a player receives (ie: puts into their crew) a character or ship (while also selling a different char or ship) - does the number-of-characters/starships that they '''have''' only stay-the-same ??? or does/did the number-of-characters that they have/own increase or decrease based upon how many slots that they had filled - each time the server checked ???
in particular, after a few weeks of playing the game - i started to buy extra slots for more characters/starships... once i had started to buy more slots, i never had a reason to SELL a char/ship again... thus, my number-of-characters was always increasing... whereas, right now - i might go ahead and sell-off all my currently-maxxed-out tier-1 and tier-2 crew/ships to get some more dilithium... i need this extra dilithium (myself) to go ahead and finish the upgrades/evolves for my other tier-3 chars/ships...
maybe someone else ran their game in a different way... maybe, they (if it is YOU, could you let me know?) only kept the minimum (or a small) number of slots... maybe, if they received a character or starship that turned out to be ''useless'' to them - they just sold it... my question is (to them) - does your number-of-characters (as revealed under alliances-area) show only: a) the current number of characters you kept ? or-b) the number of characters you EVER received ?
i am 85% certain that the answer is - it only showed the number-of-characters/ships that you had currently-kept... and '''that''' number could have been 98 (for crew) and 32 (for ships) if you had been able to ''collect them all''... i already know that if you (me) had empty-slots available that were not filled, the server ''knew'' that they were empty and the number-of-chars/ships only listed the filled-slots... if you were a minimalist and only kept what-you-needed, then it might show (for example) 6 crew and 2 ships - which is all ''I'' ever really used, consistently...
end-of-sidetrack... <hr />
of course, because of the server-functionality having been changed during this twilight-period... then this one-person who (i believe) sold all their crew/ships and started-over is still showing the full-complement of 90+ crew and 30+ ships... if i had-to-guess, this person should currently show only 6+ crew and 2+ ships - if the servers still were updating based upon arenas and events...
oh well - just curious - and the topic (which i should probably have posted as a DISCUSSION over in the [[:Special:Forum]] area somewhere really is/was:
'''''What are you doing (if anything) with the game during this twilight period ??? '''''
me ? i am trying to finish off my ''collection'' (ie: their statistics) so that this website can document ''how it was'' for posterity... how about you ? [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 22:09, September 24, 2018 (UTC)
<hr />
wellp - ive been selling off things these last few days to try and recoup enough currency to upgrade the items i have left... i just did the math and will not be able to get everything finished... i DID finish the ships - and sold all but the last two (one TOS and one TNG) which the system would not let me do... selling all of my ships DID allow me to finish upgrading the last few T3-ships with enough dilithium... whereas i still have 26 or so T3-crew to upgrade and even if i sell off the already-upgraded crew that i can - i will (at most) be able to get 5 or 6 of them levelled up with enough dilithium... also, i am still way-short of gold to upgrade a few (5) of the remaining t3-crew - even if i HAD enough dilithium to followup... oh well...
at the moment, i am just double checking spelling (english mistakes are still in-game, etc) of the items that i can (as i am selling them)... it turns out that the server IS actually checking my crew/ship status - because now when i look in the [[Archive Area]] i see all the sold-items as grey, and when i look in the [[Alliance Area]] i see the number-of-ships/crew i have is correct also... i have stopped trying to collect the daily-reward at 828-days, and afaik i was INcorrect when i thought the value was increasing even on days when i was not playing...
anyways - this is one-last shout-out to anyone who still has their game working... please let me know if you have any data for tier-3 characters... or even want to double-check my data for other characters/ships that you can still see... it's been fun, i guess... [[User:Hfelton|Hfelton]] ([[User talk:Hfelton|talk]]) 09:00, November 13, 2018 (UTC)

-- starshiplists module -- inside: [[Category:Modules]] using this line once... -- has all the functions that will operate on/about characters
-- trying to make html-tables for index, navbox, etc... -- <pre>
local p = {} local getargs = require('Dev:Arguments').getArgs local utils = require('Module:Utilities') -- see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13964764/lua-how-to-avoid-circular-requires?noredirect=1&lq=1 local cc = cc or require('Module:Starshipcodes') local gems = gems or require('Module:Gems') local glbls = require('Module:Globals')
-- semi-dummy statement because 'out' is going to hold the final html-object... glbls.out = true
-- these are only one-level-down possibles... not all possibilities in cc.expand()... local possibles = { 'name', 'image', 'imagecaption', 'aliases', 'race', 'gender', 'series', 'xnpc', 'sdate', 'aenu', 'tier', 'igp', 'lmin', 'lmax', 'limit', 'hp', 'nup', 'gorder', 'ar', 'ag', 'aw', 'code', 'key', 'currentlevel', } local defaultOrder = { 'key', 'image', 'name', 'aliases', 'code', 'tier', 'series', 'hp', } glbls.choices = defaultOrder
local function chkCrew(c) -- assume dummy-values, but put in valid ones if available... assert(type(c)=='table') local dummy = 'dummy' local rettbl = {} for _,k in ipairs(possibles) do if utils.isNotBlank(c[k]) then rettbl[k] = c[k] else rettbl[k] = dummy end end return rettbl end
local function chooseCols( cols ) -- assumes cols is a valid table already... -- do in-order of choices and with repeats... local choices = {} if utils.isSequence(cols) then for _,v in ipairs(cols) do -- for _,u in ipairs(glbls.choices) do for _,u in ipairs(possibles) do if u==v then choices[#choices+1] = v end end end else for k,v in pairs(cols) do -- for _,u in ipairs(glbls.choices) do for _,u in ipairs(possibles) do if v and u==k then choices[#choices+1] = k end end end end if #choices == 0 then choices = glbls.choices end return choices end
local function addRowSkills( idx, tbl ) local row = mw.html.create('tr') local cost = tbl[idx]['cost'] row :css('text-align','center;') :tag('td'):wikitext(idx):done() :tag('td'):wikitext(cost):done()
local desc = tbl[idx]['desc'] row :css('text-align','left;') :tag('td'):wikitext(desc):done() return row end
glbls.sorter = 0.001 local function addRow( crew, cols ) -- Init local row = mw.html.create('tr') local defaultCols = { 'key', 'image', 'aliases', }
if not cols then usecols = glbls.choices --elseif type(cols)~='table' then -- usecols = defaultCols else usecols = chooseCols(cols) end
local lnk,lnki local ser = crew.series local dirser = '' if ser=='TOS' then dirser='CO/' end if ser=='TNG' then dirser='CN/' end
for _,c in ipairs(usecols) do if c=='key' then lnk = '[['..dirser..crew.key..'|'..crew.key..']]' row :css('text-align','center;') --:tag('td'):wikitext(crew.key):done() :tag('td'):wikitext(lnk):done() elseif c=='image' then -- making link point to level-50 possibilities... lnk = dirser..'L50/'..crew.key --lnk = dirser..crew.key -- --lnki = '[[File:'..crew.image..'|35px|link= ]]' lnki = '[[File:'..crew.image..'|35px|link='..lnk..']]' -- lnki = '[[File:'..crew.image..'|35px]]' row :tag('td'):wikitext(lnki):done() elseif c=='tier' then --glbls.sorter = glbls.sorter + 0.001 --local sorter = glbls.sorter + utils.toNum(crew.tier) lnk = '[[:Category:Tier '..crew.tier..'|'..crew.tier..']]' row --:attr('data-sort-value',sorter) :tag('td'):wikitext(lnk):done() elseif c=='series' then lnk = '[[:Category:'..crew.series..' Crew|'..crew.series..']]' row :tag('td'):wikitext(lnk):done() elseif c=='hp' then lnk = utils.toNum(crew.hp,'') row :attr('data-sort-type','numeric') :tag('td'):wikitext(lnk):done() else row :tag('td'):wikitext(crew[c]):done() end -- endfor end
return row end
local function addHeaderSkills() local row = mw.html.create('tr') local cols = {'upgrade','cost','description',} for _,c in ipairs(cols) do row:tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(c)):done() end return row end
local function addHeader(cols) local row = mw.html.create('tr') local usecols = {} if not cols or type(cols)~='table' then usecols = glbls.choices else usecols = chooseCols(cols) end -- the :tag adds nodes-to-builder (row) and returns updated-instance (row) for _,c in ipairs(usecols) do if c=='key' then row :tag('th') :css('width','8%') :wikitext('Key'):done() elseif c=='series' then row :tag('th'):wikitext('TOS/TNG'):done() elseif c=='hp' or c=='tier' then local nam = c:upper() row :tag('th') :css('width','8%') --:cssText(' scope="col" data-sort-type="numeric" ') :attr('scope','col') :attr('data-sort-type','numeric') :wikitext(nam):done() else row --:tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(tostring(c))):done() :tag('th'):wikitext(utils.TitleCase(c)):done() --:tag('th'):wikitext(c):done() end -- endfor end return row end
local function isGoodExpansion(unk) retval = false if type(unk) == 'string' then -- skip unknown and cannot-use strings... -- obscure-feature 'true' for no-magic-pattern-chars -- see: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.find if not string.find(unk,'dbl-exp',1,true) then retval = true end elseif utils.isSimple(unk) then -- order is important, because strings would normally be ok... retval = true else retval = false end return retval end
local function loadCrewSkillsBegin(k) local fakeFrame = {} local getvals,chkreadargs local rtbl = {} --local basics = {'skill','color',} local basics = {'skill','color','cost',} --local basics = {'skill','color','cost','desc',} fakeFrame[1] = k fakeFrame[2] = 'skills' for i = 1,3 do rtbl[i] = {} for _,c in ipairs(basics) do fakeFrame[3] = c..tostring(i) chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then rtbl[i][c] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end -- remove empty-skills if utils.tblFullSize(rtbl[i]) == 0 then rtbl[i] = nil end --if rtbl[i] then rtbl[i]['desc']='end['..tostring(i)..']' end end return rtbl end local function loadCrewSkillsEnd(k,begtbl) local fakeFrame = {} local getvals,chkreadargs local rtbl = {} --rtbl.key = k fakeFrame[1] = k for sk,_ in ipairs(begtbl) do rtbl[sk] = {} local defCost = begtbl[sk]['cost'] for up = 1,5 do fakeFrame[2] = sk fakeFrame[3] = up rtbl[sk][up] = {} -- this forces all skill-upgrades to provide a 'desc' field !!! chkreadargs = cc.createSkillsString(fakeFrame) rtbl[sk][up]['desc'] = chkreadargs chkreadargs = cc.createSkillsCost(fakeFrame) if chkreadargs=='false' then rtbl[sk][up]['cost'] = defCost else rtbl[sk][up]['cost'] = chkreadargs end end end return rtbl end
local function mkCrewCategories(rtbl,choice) local rstbl = {} local retval = '' for key,val in pairs(rtbl) do if choice=='print' then rstbl[#rstbl+1] = '[[:Category:'..val..'|'..val..']]' elseif choice=='colors' then if key:sub(1,5)=='color' then -- rstbl[#rstbl+1] = '[[:Category:'..val..']]' rstbl[#rstbl+1] = '[[Category:'..val..']]' retval = retval..rstbl[#rstbl] end else end end if choice=='print' then retval = utils.dumpTable(rstbl) end --return rstbl return retval end
local function loadCrewCategories(k) local fakeFrame = {} local getvals,chkreadargs local rtbl = {} local rstbl = {} local basics = {'series','tier',} local colors = {'color1','color2','color3'} local convert = {tier='Tier ',} fakeFrame[1] = k for i = 1,#basics do fakeFrame[2] = basics[i] chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then --rtbl[#rtbl+1] = tostring(chkreadargs) rtbl[basics[i]] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end for i = 1,#colors do fakeFrame[2] = 'skills' fakeFrame[3] = colors[i] chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then --rtbl[#rtbl+1] = tostring(chkreadargs) rtbl[colors[i]] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end for key,val in pairs(rtbl) do for chk1,cnv2 in pairs(convert) do if key==chk1 then val = cnv2..tostring(val) end end rstbl[key] = val end return rstbl end
local function loadCrewOneOthersUpgrades(k,chosens,upg1,upg2) local fakeFrame = {} local chkreadargs local rtbl = {} local ffnum fakeFrame[1] = k rtbl.key = k if type(upg1)~='string' then return rtbl end fakeFrame[2] = 'othersUpgrades' fakeFrame[3] = upg1 if not upg2 then ffnum = 4 end if type(upg2)~='string' then ffnum = 4 else fakeFrame[4] = upg2 ffnum = 5 end if not chosens then chosens = possibles end if type(chosens)~='table' then chosens = possibles end for _,c in ipairs(chosens) do fakeFrame[ffnum] = c chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then rtbl[c] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end return rtbl end
local function loadCrewOne(k,chosens) local fakeFrame = {} local getvals,chkreadargs local rtbl = {} fakeFrame[1] = k rtbl.key = k if not chosens then chosens = possibles end if type(chosens)~='table' then chosens = possibles end for _,c in ipairs(chosens) do fakeFrame[2] = c chkreadargs = cc.expand(fakeFrame) if isGoodExpansion(chkreadargs) then rtbl[c] = tostring(chkreadargs) end end return rtbl end
local function mkRow(k,cols) local newrow, chkvals local crew = loadCrewOne(k) crew.key = k chkvals = chkCrew(crew) newrow = addRow( chkvals, cols ) return newrow end
local function mkIndex() local allkeys = cc.getAK(fakeFrame) local r -- to hold extra nodes/rows glbls.out = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') r = addHeader() glbls.out:node(r) -- adds a child-node of (row) to current-instance (table) for _,key in ipairs(allkeys) do r = mkRow(key) glbls.out:node(r) end r = addHeader() glbls.out:node(r) return glbls.out end
local function chooser(k,c,v) -- end up loading the row twice... local crew = loadCrewOne(k) if crew[c]==v then return true else return false end end
local function mkTable(cols,choose,rows) local allkeys = cc.getAK(fakeFrame) local r glbls.out = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') r = addHeader(cols) glbls.out:node(r) for _,key in ipairs(allkeys) do if not choose or chooser(key,choose,rows) then r = mkRow(key,cols) glbls.out:node(r) end end r = addHeader(cols) glbls.out:node(r) return glbls.out end
local function mkColorDiv(skColor,txt) local tmp, tmp2, tmp3 -- need more checks on 'color'... assert(type(skColor)=='string') tmp2 = skColor:lower()..";" if utils.isBlank(txt) then txt = skColor end tmp3 = '[[:Category:'..txt..'|'..txt..']]' tmp = mw.html.create('span') tmp :css('color',tmp2) -- :wikitext(txt) :wikitext(tmp3) return tmp end
local function mkTableSkillsOne(begT,endT,chooseNum) local r local outDiv = mw.html.create('div') local outTbl = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') --glbls.out = mw.html.create('table'):addClass('wikitable sortable') local skName = begT[chooseNum]['skill'] local skColor = begT[chooseNum]['color']
outDiv :attr('id',skName) :wikitext('Skill Number '..chooseNum..' is called ') :wikitext("'''"..skName.."'''.") :newline() --:wikitext('Its color is '..skColor..'.') :wikitext('Its color is ') --:node(mkColorDiv(skColor)):done() :node(mkColorDiv(skColor)) :wikitext('. '..gems.one({skColor,'15'})) :newline()
r = addHeaderSkills() outTbl:node(r)
--local upgrTbl = utils.tableShallowCopy(endT[chooseNum]) local upgrTbl = endT[chooseNum] for up = 1,#upgrTbl do r = addRowSkills(up,upgrTbl) outTbl:node(r) end
outDiv :node(outTbl) :newline() :newline() :newline() :newline() --:tag('hr') --:done()
return outDiv end local function mkTableSkills(begT,endT) local retOut glbls.out = mw.html.create() for i=1,#begT do retOut = mkTableSkillsOne(begT,endT,i):done() glbls.out:node(retOut) end return glbls.out
end
--- hello-world to setup testcases correctly... function mkUpgradetemplate(k,upNum) -- check k for good person-key... -- check upNum for good values ('up10',...) local fakeFrame = {} --local str01 = '{{#invoke:Charactercodes|expand|' local items01 = { 'image', 'name', 'series', 'limit', 'tier', 'lmin', } --local str02 = 'othersUpgrades|up10|' -- local items02 = { 'ag', 'ar', 'aw', 'hp', 'gorder', -- 'currentlevel', 'skillschosen', } local items02 = { 'ag', 'ar', 'aw', 'hp', 'currentlevel', } --local str03 = 'datavalues|' -- local items03 = { 'dv1', 'dv2', 'dv3', 'dv4', 'dv5', 'dv6', } local retval local tmptbl, tmp retval = '{{Infobox starship2
' tmptbl = loadCrewOne(k,items01) --retval = retval .. utils.dumpTable(tmptbl) for _,v in ipairs(items01) do tmp = ' = '..tmptbl[v]..'
' retval = retval..'|'..v..tmp end tmptbl = loadCrewOneOthersUpgrades(k,items02,upNum) for _,v in ipairs(items02) do tmp = ' = '..tmptbl[v]..'
' retval = retval..'|'..v..tmp end -- tmptbl = loadCrewOneOthersUpgrades(k,items03,upNum,'datavalues') -- for _,v in ipairs(items03) do -- tmp = ' = '..tmptbl[v]..'
' -- retval = retval..'|'..v..tmp -- end -- failsafe: if dv returns a string (rather than a number) them abort... -- if tmp:sub(1,6)==' = Unk' then return '' end -- return retval..'}}' --return tmp end
--- hello-world to setup testcases correctly... function p.main(frame) local a = getargs(frame) local what = a[1] local how = a[2] local which = a[3] local value = a[4] local out if what=='index' then out = mkIndex() elseif (what=='testSkills') or (what=='skills') then local begtbl = loadCrewSkillsBegin(how) local endtbl = loadCrewSkillsEnd(how,begtbl) if what=='skills' then out = mkTableSkills(begtbl,endtbl) else out = utils.dumpTable(begtbl) --out = out..'

'..utils.dumpTable(endtbl) end -- elseif what=='skills' then -- local begtbl = loadCrewSkillsBegin(how) -- local endtbl = loadCrewSkillsEnd(how,begtbl) elseif what=='printUp03' then out = mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up03') elseif what=='printUp09' then out = mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up09') elseif what=='printUp10' then out = mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up10') elseif what=='printUp15' then out = mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up15') elseif what=='mkUp03' then return frame:preprocess(mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up03')) elseif what=='mkUp09' then return frame:preprocess(mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up09')) elseif what=='mkUp10' then return frame:preprocess(mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up10')) elseif what=='mkUp15' then return frame:preprocess(mkUpgradetemplate(how,'up15')) elseif what=='testJSON' then local test1 = { 'key', 'image', 'name', } local test2 = { 'key', 'image', 'name', tier=2, } local test3 = '["key","image","name","tier"]' local en1 = utils.JSONencodeTable2String(test1) local en2 = utils.JSONencodeTable2String(test2) local de1 = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(en1) local de2 = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(en2) local de3 = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(test3) local out1,out2,out3 out1 = '>>>'..utils.dumpTable(test1)..'<<< encodes to: >>>'..en1..'<<< and decodes to: >>>'..utils.dumpTable(de1)..'<<<


' out2 = '>>>'..utils.dumpTable(test2)..'<<< encodes to: >>>'..en2..'<<< and decodes to: >>>'..utils.dumpTable(de2)..'<<<


' out3 = '>>>'..utils.dumpTable(test3)..'<<< decodes to: >>>'..utils.dumpTable(de3)..'<<<


' out = out1..out2..out3 elseif what=='table' then local tblHow = {} if how:sub(1,2)=='["' then tblHow = utils.JSONdecodeString2Table(how) end if #tblHow==0 then --out = mkTable(tblHow,which,value) out = "Hello, table! - doing... "..what.. " ...using how... "..how.. " ...choosing which... "..which.. " ...as value... "..value.." ???


" else --out1 = '


how...>>>'..how..'<<<


' --out2 = '


how...>>>'..how:sub(1,1)..'<<<


' out = mkTable(tblHow,which,value) --out = out1..out2..tostring(out3) end elseif what=='categories' then local cattbl local hero = tostring(value) out = '' -- making string backwards (pre-pending) below cuz easier to do logic... if which=='one' then out = out..'for one hero...
' if hero~='' then out = out..'named >'..hero..'< ...
' cattbl = loadCrewCategories(hero) else out = out..'who needs to be named !?!?!?...


' end elseif which=='all' then out = out..'for all the heroes...
' if hero~='' then out = out..'ignoring >'..hero..'< ...
' end else out = out..'dont know for which heroes...
' end -- PREpending... if how=='print' then out = 'print out the categories...
'..out --rtbl = mkCrewCategories(cattbl,how) --out2 = utils.dumpTable(rtbl) out2 = mkCrewCategories(cattbl,how) out = out..'
'..out2 elseif how=='colors' then out = 'add the color categories to the category-list...
'..out --rtbl = mkCrewCategories(cattbl,how) --out2 = utils.dumpTable(rtbl) out2 = mkCrewCategories(cattbl,how) out = out2 elseif how=='replace' then out = 'replace all the categories...
'..out elseif how=='append' then out = 'append to current categories...
'..out elseif how=='remove' then out = 'remove one categories...
'..out elseif how=='zero' then out = 'remove all the categories...
'..out elseif how=='fix' then out = 'fix the categories...
'..out else out = 'dont know how to work with the categories...
'..out end -- back to usual appending... -- out = out..'


' else -- out = "Hello, world! - doing..."..what..utils.dumpTable(glbls.data) out = "Hello, world! - doing... "..tostring(what).. " ...using how... "..tostring(how).. " ...choosing which... "..tostring(which).. " ...as value... "..tostring(value).." ???


" end return tostring( out ) end
return p

revision.comment: Created page with "ok - i know that the game is about to end... and many folks were quite pissed about the way that they did the shutoff/twilight... be that as it may, the devs (i am guessing)..."
revision.text:
ok - i know that the game is about to end... and many folks were quite pissed about the way that they did the shutoff/twilight... be that as it may, the devs (i am guessing) are actually '''trying''' to be nice to us (the fans who enjoyed the game) during these last couple of months...
one way that i THINK they are being nice (besides not just shutting-everything-down without any notice) is... i believe that they went thru their server-database and updated a field (or more?)... specifically, a couple of weeks ago - i had a daily-prize-count of 750+ days...
now, i have no special knowledge of anything, but iirc that number (750+) was based upon how many days that i had ACTIVELY won any of the mini-games... also, iirc, that number would only increase by my winning ACTIVELY another mini-game... also, iirc, if any player had less-than some number (i will take a wild-ass-guess and say 90-ish) of days playing - they could tell each day what their NEXT prize would be...
ok - so back in 2006 when '''''i''''' started playing, i would play a mini-game (lets say i advanced in the storyline, or i won one level of an event, or i beat one person in an arena challenge) and - if it had been over a day since i had last won a mini-game - i would see a screen pop up declaring my daily prize for the day... these daily prizes were semi-random (like some health-points or some wrench-fixings or even some dilithium or gold currency), but back-then when that screen popped up - it would show me what the prize was going to be for the NEXT day... and that was a small motivator to get me to come-back because i oftentimes NEEDED that next-prize... and, even if i didnt need that-particular next-prize, knowing that the next-days prize might soon be important-to-me - was fun...
anyways - sometime later (i am assuming it was after 90+ days, but it might have been for some other reason) the knowledge of WHAT the next-days prize might be, changed... specifically, it turned into a blank-box with a question-mark on it... and that was fine too - i would have to come back the next day to find-out what i had won... fun...
again - i have become sidetracked... that number (how many days i had ACTIVELY won any mini-game) would only increase one-by-one based upon actual days i played... if i missed a day, then that number was the same - and other than my own personal goal of playing every day to win a prize, that was fine too...
however - TODAY (during this twilight time for the game), i realized that i had not been playing any of the mini-games to win daily-prizes... and i still wanted/needed some of those daily-prizes... so i finally (lets say it has been a week or two since the last event finished off) went back to the storyline and played one mini-game (and won) to get my latest unknown prize-box... and it said that my daily-count was 790+ days !!!
ok - that seemed weird... had my number jumped up by 40 days when i wasnt paying attention ? or had it ''always'' been around that amount ? so i typed that number into a date-calculator and it game me some date in late-july-2016... if i had to guess, that was probably the first-day that i DID play this game... and i started this fan-site in august... neato !!!
i am about 50-50 sure that a dev on the game went into the server-database and updated that field for us... so, now if you want to compare with your friend - how long you were playing (rather than just how many consecutive days you won a mini-game) - you could DO so !!! that is quite cool - and thanx (to whoever did that)... so, i didnt grab a screenshot (i probably should) but now i can ask anyone else (i think) - and they might have an answer that makes sense...
what does '''YOUR''' daily prize number say ? it should (now) list when the main-server thinks you actually started playing (i hope)... or, if you rarely played the game at all - but still have it available on your phone (or whereever) - is that number ''now'' some ridiculously high value ?
curious readers (or at least this single admin here) want to know...
h.<ac_metadata title="how long were you playing the game ?"> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "Did anyone contact with genera to ask if they want to leave this game like it is until november or there will be al least one more event or arena game to play? Maybe its worth..."
revision.text: Did anyone contact with genera to ask if they want to leave this game like it is until november or there will be al least one more event or arena game to play? Maybe its worth to ask and maybe we will get a few more weeks to play not just to look at our stats.

revision.comment: Created page with "i can only speak for myself (and truly, i am fairly alone here - and have no secret inside info... i just make inferences from the outside) - but nope... i did not contact t..."
revision.text:
i can only speak for myself (and truly, i am fairly alone here - and have no secret inside info... i just make inferences from the outside) - but nope... i did not contact them - but maybe you could ?
if i were a bit more bold (and actually was thinking about it, but had not yet put the details together), i-myself would actually like to ask if they would not mind giving my account xxxx-dilithium and yyyy-gold extra so that i can update my last dozen or so tier-3 items...
true - actually playing the game like we used-to would be fun too... in particular, maybe even trying all the other ships and characters that i never even tried would be cool - if they reopened their events a/o arenas...
in the past (and the way it [game]) was sorta designed, a goal was to try and '''be the best''' by winning and getting high-scores...
thus, once it was decided to close-down - i guess they figured it would be safest to stop the competitions semi-immediately so that noone would sneak-in and '''win''' in a weird way... again, this is just my inference - who knows what the actual decision-process was like... heck, i have a feeling that the actual business-driver is something odd like they lost their license to use star-trek (tm) items by the end-of-the-year... who knows...
but again, to answer your question... no - _I_ do not know of anyone that has contacted genera (in-game or externally)... anything that _I_ have been doing, like with this website/wikia/fandom-space has been a solo-effort... if there was someplace else (besides reddit [i dont have an account on reddit, i just read-anonymously]) where folks gathered to have discussions about this game - i cannot speak to...
and - of course - welcome to the site !!! again, sorry it is during this twilight-period... and i have no idea what will happen once it goes completely dark in november...
h.

revision.comment: Created page with "I've only been playing for 127 days. I'm sad the game is ending. I hadn't played for a while and just came back to it a couple of months ago. Is there anything similar out ..."
revision.text:
I've only been playing for 127 days. I'm sad the game is ending. I hadn't played for a while and just came back to it a couple of months ago.
Is there anything similar out there?

revision.comment: Created page with "welcome !!! 127 days is STILL several months... sorry that it seems to be dying-off now... q: similar ? a: idk... :-/ at the moment, im still just futzing around trying..."
revision.text:
welcome !!! 127 days is STILL several months... sorry that it seems to be dying-off now...
q: similar ? a: idk... :-/
at the moment, im still just futzing around trying to wrap up the details that im interested in on this wikia... i have not yet gone to look-around for similar games... since i am not sure what (about THIS game) was most-interesting for you, maybe let us (readers) know and someone might have a recommendation...
i DO know that i stumbled onto this game because my play-store recommended it... and it (play-store) probably decided to recommend it because i used to (and still occasionally DO) play a doctor-who gem-matching-type game... if you are interested in it - it, too, is now in more of a maintenance-mode... however, it (imho) was better-coded originally so there were not as many bugs to stumble against... anyways - try the wikia (and game) [[w:c:dwlegacy|Doctor Who Legacy]] assuming i have typed the interwiki link correctly...
hth, h.

revision.comment: Created page with "267 days, more or less played every day. Got lots of level 3 thing's to level up but now it's not going to happen."
revision.text: 267 days, more or less played every day. Got lots of level 3 thing's to level up but now it's not going to happen.

wow - 267 is almost a year... i thought i had already said "hello, welcome" to this message when i noticed it yesterday - but apparently i must notve hit "send"...
anyways - yeah, like you, i still am trying to mini-grind up my tier-3 stuff... it is even slower now with nothing new to play... but - maybe someone who DID manage to get their tier-3 characters/ship up to [[Level165]] will chime in and at least let us know what their values were...
i got all of my tier-3 items up to [[Level95]], but none are much higher than that... maybe i will need to create some in-between area (like level-115 or level-135) just to put some final documentation in before the game disappears-forever in november... sigh...
anyways - again, '''welcome''' and sorry the game is in its twilight-zone... :)
ETA: PS - the ships DO have data in the database, i just didnt finish writing the code to show the ships correctly... that is why they (ships only) show a ''tbd'' message on their higher levels... i will try and fix that coding-problem this weekend...

revision.comment: Created page with "Thanks for the recommendation Hfelton I will check out the Dr Who game. I enjoyed the "chase" to level up and collect ships and characters and then work on leveling them up. I..."
revision.text:
Thanks for the recommendation Hfelton I will check out the Dr Who game. I enjoyed the "chase" to level up and collect ships and characters and then work on leveling them up. I liked trying to match gems with the most value to charge the abilities and there was something very satisfying when ships blew up lol
127 days
== Summary == day 799 == Licensing == {{Fairuse}}

revision.comment: Created page with "howdee again 127, yeah - the little BLOW-UP animations were very cool... lol... the dr.who game has all of the other stuff, plus a little bit more - in particular, you are ..."
revision.text:
howdee again 127,
yeah - the little BLOW-UP animations were very cool... lol...
the dr.who game has all of the other stuff, plus a little bit more - in particular, you are not limited to only moving one-pair of gems that are next-to-each-other... once you have started playing ''that'' game for awhile, it will keep you busy on its own version of '''the grind''' for ages and ages... the first step after getting frustrated over-there is to unlock their [[w:c:dwlegacy:Fan Area]] for $5 and get access to lots more grind-able levels...
oddly, if i were a different type of geek - id try to figure out a way to keep '''''this''''' game active (at least locally) for after they take the servers down... but i doubt anyone (besides a few hard-core fans) will even care about it (this game) after november...
anyways - besides the dr.who game, it seems like there is a different star-trek (tm) game called ''timelines'' or something which i see advertisements for... it (st-timelines) probably would be cool to play too... idk...
hmmm - maybe i will call myself 800-days now (since im oh-so-close)... [[File:Screenshot 20180928-173255.png]]
Mine was over 600

revision.comment: Created page with "hello 600 and welcome !!! wellp, i finally generated enough gold to finish my starships... unfortunately, i was only able to get them all up to about lvl-115 and i only have ..."
revision.text:
hello 600 and welcome !!!
wellp, i finally generated enough gold to finish my starships... unfortunately, i was only able to get them all up to about lvl-115 and i only have 700k dilithium left... i think that i could get them all (ships) to [[Level165]] if i had 1.8 M dilithium; but that is not gonna be possible...
im thinking that ''maybe'' i can sell off my ships to generate more dilithium to finish upgrading them up...
hey - btw - did any of yall (600, 127, or 267) actually get anything of the tier-3 stuff up to full-power ??? ie - any [[Level165]] info that i could add to the database ? if so, '''''please''''' let me know - and i can figure out how to get it up here before they take everything down (in-game) in november... tia, h.
[[Category:Governments]]

revision.comment: Created page with "I am sitting at 741. I have the Enterprise B up to level 165 as well as several tier 3 characters. I pretty much haven't missed a day in the last two-plus years. I feel like I..."
revision.text: I am sitting at 741. I have the Enterprise B up to level 165 as well as several tier 3 characters. I pretty much haven't missed a day in the last two-plus years. I feel like I'm being dumped.

revision.comment: Created page with "wecome 741 !!! i am '''so''' sorry that you are feeling dumped... i dont know what to say, if anything, that might make it better... i seem to remember reading somewher..."
revision.text:
wecome 741 !!!
i am '''so''' sorry that you are feeling dumped... i dont know what to say, if anything, that might make it better...
i seem to remember reading somewhere that cbs (tm) has been going after their licensing rights for star trek (tm) and causing heartache elsewhere too... i floated a ''guess'' that maybe they pulled their license agreememnt with the game-makers too... or maybe it (license) just ran out and they (cbs) decided not to renew it... honestly, i have no idea what the reasons/reasoning was...
but - you got the [[Enterprise B]] up to [[Level165]] also ??? very cool !!! i still havent finished writing the code to get the correct info to load (for starships) - but the data in the data-module that i have so far said the following: * hp = 4854 * red/grn/white = 96/85/83 does that match (or come close) to the data you show ? i sold my en-b at lvl-165 so that i could go back to playing lower-lvl battles, so right now my en-b is only up to lvl-115 which says (instead): * hp = 3404 * r/g/w = 68/60/59 i guess i could/should re-level-up my en-b to see if the numbers match again... that (RE-levelling up) is something i havent done yet with the only two items [[Enterprise B]] and [[Q]] i ever got up to that high a level..
btw - if i look at my en-b from the archive/stardock-area, i see different values because that includes my weapons/crew as loaded... for me, at lvl-115 for en-b, i am seeing r/g/w at 143/131/120 - but no value for the hp... i need to go into the ''ACTUAL'' stardock area and read the hp-value from the green-bar of the ship, itself...
anyways - even if you dont want to check your ship-data and/or keep chatting here... again, welcome - 741 !!!
sincerely, hfelton (i guess i will stick with 800 even tho im at 802 or some-such really)... '''''800'''''

ps - my '''goal''' with the higher-level characters/ships would be as shown with [[Q]] which has a correctly (afaik) filled-in set of values for [[CN/L50/QQ]], [[CN/L96/QQ]], and [[CN/L165/QQ]]...
edit - typos on q, cuz using qq... edit2 - typo i guess i used l96, not l95... sigh...

revision.comment: Created page with "just curiosity - we are currently in the twilight and (for me) i think that i would have felt like i had reached '''''the end''''' if i had managed to upgrade/evolve/level-up ..."
revision.text:
just curiosity - we are currently in the twilight and (for me) i think that i would have felt like i had reached '''''the end''''' if i had managed to upgrade/evolve/level-up all of the ships and crew to their maximum amounts ?
as far as steps needed to accomplish that goal, i see: # purchase/recruit every character and starship # evolve/upgrade every one
i managed to do step-1, but i am still fairly far away from accomplishing step-2 - and i do not think i will get there before the game shuts down... i mean, i can still spin-the-wheel and do minor rehashes of the regular-game to get more currency - but overall id need about 55.k of gold and 50.M of dilithium...
for me, the details of what-i-have-left to do are the tier-3 stuff as mentioned at [[Level165]]... all the other characters and crew are already at their max amounts for [[Level95]] and [[Level50]]...
how about you ? would it help if i made some sort of checklist ? or is it just ''me'' that cares... :) h.
i guess an ALTERNATE way of measuring ''the end'' is that there are only 5 weeks and 1 day till the drop-dead date of nov-15, 2018...<ac_metadata title="how close were you to the end ?"> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "I had, for the past couple of weeks noticed that when i was spinning the wheel - and receiving Gold coins - that I was making faster progress than expected... Just now - I wa..."
revision.text:
I had, for the past couple of weeks noticed that when i was spinning the wheel - and receiving Gold coins - that I was making faster progress than expected...
Just now - I watched the score-keeping responses very closely and noticed: the bonus was getting applied TWICE !!!
is this ''double bonus'' effect happening for anyone else ? '''everyone''' else ? am i the only one who cares ? i just want to say '''''THANK YOU''''' to the devs for this little extra act of helpfulness during our twilight time...
just thought anyone else (if they care or needed it) would appreciate the ''heads up''... have fun, h.<ac_metadata title="DOUBLE Bonuses ???"> </ac_metadata>

i was going back thru some older messages and remembered that this IP was used by someone who claimed to have all tier-3 ships/crew fully evolved up... i am leaving a message here to ask:
will you please contact me ?
i started to do a reverse-lookup on this IP address and got bogged down with details... first it said Iowa, then Pennsylvania - but whereever you are does not matter really... i would just like to chat with you about your data - so that i can try and ADD it to the database here...
sincerely, harold felton
edit - typo<ac_metadata title="HELLO !?!?"> </ac_metadata>

revision.comment: Created page with "hmmm - maybe not... maybe it was just a one-off fluke... cuz now i am not seeing it any more... awww... possibly it is just a quirk with the game again... my phone might ..."
revision.text:
hmmm - maybe not... maybe it was just a one-off fluke... cuz now i am not seeing it any more... awww...
possibly it is just a quirk with the game again... my phone might not be getting a good signal and sometimes sends a command twice ? idk... but the past few rounds after that initial '''neato''' moment, i have not seen the doubling occur again...
hmmm - that one doubling occurred when i got the best-prize of the question-reward of gold... that reward, in the past, was 200-gold... and i saw the 200-gold prize get added twice to my score - because i was paying close attention to it... idk... sigh...

 | crewamt      =

 | crtyp        =

 | wptyp          =
}}
